#主分类(中文)	HPO编号	名称(英文)	定义(英文)	中文译名	中文定义
生长异常	HP:0000002	Abnormality of body height	Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	身高异常	身高偏离该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000003	Multicystic kidney dysplasia	Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvocaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.	多囊性肾发育不良	多囊性肾发育不良的特点是：肾脏有大小不一的肾囊肿，缺乏正常肾盂肾盏系统。这种状态伴发输尿管或肾盂输尿管闭锁，受累肾脏无功能。
遗传模式	HP:0000005	Mode of inheritance	The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.	遗传模式	#####
遗传模式	HP:0000006	Autosomal dominant inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.	常染色体显性遗传	#####
遗传模式	HP:0000007	Autosomal recessive inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in homozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, autosomal recessive disorders manifest in homozygotes (with two copies of the mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).	常染色体隐性遗传	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000008	Abnormality of female internal genitalia	An abnormality of the `female internal genitalia` (FMA:45654).	女性内生殖器异常	女性内生殖器（FMA：45654）的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000009	Functional abnormality of the bladder	`Dysfunction` (PATO:0001641) of the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900).	膀胱功能异常	膀胱（FMA：15900）的功能异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000010	Recurrent urinary tract infections	Repeated infections of the urinary tract.	复发性尿路感染	尿路反复感染。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000011	Neurogenic bladder	An inability to completely empty the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) during the process of `urination` (GO:0060073) owing to a neurological condition.	神经源性膀胱功能障碍	由于神经系统疾患导致排尿过程中无法完全排空膀胱（FMA：15900）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000012	Urinary urgency	Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.	尿急	突然的强烈排尿感导致急迫性尿失禁。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000013	Hypoplasia of the uterus	Underdevelopment of the `uterus` (FMA:17558).	子宫发育不良	子宫（FMA：17558）发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000014	Abnormality of the bladder	An abnormality of the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900).	膀胱异常	发生在膀胱（FMA：15900）的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000015	Bladder diverticulum	`Diverticulum` (MPATH:68) (sac or pouch) in the `wall of the urinary bladder` (FMA:15902).	膀胱憩室	膀胱壁（FMA：15902）上存在憩室（MPATH：68）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000016	Urinary retention	Inability to completely empty the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) during the process of `urination` (GO:0060073).	尿潴留	排尿过程中无法完全排空膀胱（FMA：15900）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000017	Nocturia	Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.	夜尿症	夜间尿量异常增多导致异乎寻常的频繁排尿。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000019	Urinary hesitancy	Difficulty in beginning the process of `urination` (GO:0060073).	排尿踌躇	排尿（GO：0060073）开始时不畅。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000020	Urinary incontinence	Loss of the ability to control the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) leading to involuntary `urination` (GO:0060073).	尿失禁	膀胱（FMA：15900）控制能力丧失，导致非自主性排尿（GO：0060073）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000021	Megacystis	Dilatation of the bladder postnatally.	巨膀胱症	出生后膀胱扩张。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000022	Abnormality of male internal genitalia	An abnormality of the `male internal genitalia` (FMA:45655).	男性内生殖器异常	男性内生殖器（FMA：45655）的异常。
结缔组织异常,消化系统异常	HP:0000023	Inguinal hernia	Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.	腹股沟疝	经由腹股沟的腹腔内容物的突起。
泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000024	Prostatitis	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `prostate` (FMA:9600).	前列腺炎	前列腺（FMA：9600）出现炎症（MPATH：212）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000025	Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia	#####	男性内生殖器功能异常	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000026	Male hypogonadism	"Decreased functionality" (PATO:0001624) of the male gonad, i.e., of the "testis" (FMA:7210).	男性性腺功能减退症	男性性腺即睾丸功能减退。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000027	Azoospermia	Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen.	无精症	精液中检测不到精子。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000028	Cryptorchidism	Absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the testis.	隐睾	阴囊内一侧或双侧睾丸缺如，是由于睾丸未通过腹股沟管下降到阴囊。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000029	Testicular atrophy	Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.	睾丸萎缩	睾丸萎缩表现为体积减小和潜在的生育能力丧失。
肿瘤,泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000030	Testicular gonadoblastoma	The presence of a `gonadoblastoma` (MPATH:315) of the `testis` (FMA:7210).	睾丸性腺母细胞瘤	睾丸部位形成的性腺母细胞瘤。
泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000031	Epididymitis	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `epididymis` (FMA:18255).	附睾炎	附睾发生的炎症 。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000032	Abnormality of male external genitalia	An abnormality of `male external genitalia` (FMA:45642).	男性外生殖器异常	男性外生殖器的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000033	Ambiguous genitalia, male	`Ambiguous genitalia` (HP:0000062) in an individual with XY genetic gender.	男性外阴性别不明	遗传学性别为XY的个体，其外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000034	Hydrocele testis	Accumulation of clear fluid in the  between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.	睾丸鞘膜积液	睾丸鞘膜层之间积聚透明液体。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000035	Abnormality of the testis	An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).	睾丸异常	睾丸（男性性腺）的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000036	Abnormality of the penis	#####	阴茎异常	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000037	Male pseudohermaphroditism	Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.	男性假两性畸形	两性畸形是指性腺的形态和外生殖器不吻合。男性假两性畸形的染色体核型为男性（XY），但外生殖器呈不完全男性化、模棱两可或完全女性化。如果有性腺，则是睾丸。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000039	Epispadias	Displacement of the urethral opening on the dorsal (superior) surface of the penis.	尿道上裂	尿道口开口异常，开口在阴茎背侧（上面）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000040	Enlarged penis	#####	阴茎增大	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000041	Chordee	A condition in which the head of the penis curves downward.	阴茎下曲	阴茎头向下弯曲。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000042	Absent external genitalia	Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.	外生殖器缺如	男性或女性无外生殖器。
泌尿生殖系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000044	Hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism	Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).	低促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症	低促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症以性腺（男性的睾丸，女性的卵巢）功能降低为特征，是垂体促性腺激素缺乏所致，如卵泡刺激素（FSH）和促黄体生成激素（LH）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000045	Abnormality of the scrotum	#####	阴囊异常	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000046	Scrotal hypoplasia	#####	阴囊发育不良	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000047	Hypospadias	Displacement of the urethral opening on the ventral (inferior) surface of the penis.	尿道下裂	尿道口开口位于阴茎的腹侧（下部）。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000048	Bifid scrotum	Separation of the two halves of the scrotum, whereby commonly the 2 halves of the scrotum meet above the penis.	阴囊对裂	阴囊分离成左右两部分，这两半阴囊通常在阴茎上部汇合。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000049	Shawl scrotum	A condition in which the upper scrotal skin rises over the base of the penis.	披肩状阴囊	阴囊上部皮肤上升至阴茎根部。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000050	Hypoplastic male external genitalia	Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).	男性外生殖器发育不良	男性外生殖器（包括阴茎、阴囊和尿道）全部或部分发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000051	Perineal hypospadias	Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.	会阴型尿道下裂	尿道口位于会阴部的尿道下裂。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000052	Urethral atresia, male	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.	男性尿道闭锁	一种先天性异常，男性的尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成开口。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000053	Macroorchidism	The presence of abnormally large testes.	巨睾	异常的大睾丸。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000054	Micropenis	Abnormally small `penis` (FMA:9707). At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.	小阴茎	异常小的阴茎。出生时，正常阴茎大约长3厘米（从耻骨结节到龟头顶端拉直了量得的长度），小于2.0-2.5厘米为小阴茎。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000055	Abnormality of female external genitalia	An abnormality of the `female external genitalia` (FMA:45649).	女性外生殖器异常	女性外生殖器的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000056	Abnormality of the clitoris	An abnormality of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂异常	阴蒂的异常。
	HP:0000057	Clitoromegaly	`Increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂肥大	阴蒂体积增大。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000058	Abnormality of the labia	An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.	阴唇异常	阴唇的异常，阴蒂是女阴外部可见部分。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000059	Hypoplastic labia majora	Undergrowth of the outer labia.	大阴唇发育不良	大阴唇发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000060	Clitoral hypoplasia	Developmental hypoplasia of the `clitoris` (FMA:9909).	阴蒂发育不良	阴蒂的发育低下。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000061	Ambiguous genitalia, female	`Ambiguous genitalia` (HP:0000062) in an individual with XX genetic gender.	女性外阴性别不明	遗传学性别为XX个体的外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000062	Ambiguous genitalia	A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.	外阴性别不明	根据生殖器外型无法确定是属于哪一种性别。外阴性别不明可以使用Prader计分来进行评估：Prader 0:正常女性外生殖器；Prader 1:女性外阴但阴蒂增大；Prader 2:阴蒂较大，阴唇部分融合，形成漏斗状阴道口；Prader 3:阴茎增大，阴唇完全融合形成尿生殖窦，有单一的尿道开口。Prader 4:阴囊完全融合，泌尿生殖口在阴茎的根部或阴茎上，类似尿道下裂；Prader 5:正常男性外生殖器。Prader 1-4 诊断为外阴性别不明。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000063	Fused labia minora	Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.	小阴唇融合	由于阴唇粘连造成小阴唇融合，导致阴道梗阻。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000064	Hypoplastic labia minora	#####	小阴唇发育不良	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000065	Labial hypertrophy	#####	阴唇肥厚	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000066	Labial hypoplasia	#####	阴唇发育不良	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000067	Urethral atresia, female	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.	女性尿道闭锁	一种先天性异常，女性的尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成开口。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000068	Urethral atresia	Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.	尿道闭锁	一种先天性异常，尿道开口闭锁或未发育形成开口。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000069	Abnormality of the ureter	An abnormality of the `ureter` (FMA:9704).	输尿管异常	输尿管的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000070	Ureterocele	A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.	输尿管囊肿	输尿管远端段先天性囊状扩张。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000071	Ureteral stenosis	The presence of a stenotic, i.e., `constricted` (PATO:0001847) `ureter` (FMA:9704).	输尿管狭窄	输尿管狭窄，即输尿管缢缩。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000072	Hydroureter	The distention of the `ureter` (FMA:9704) with urine.	输尿管积水	输尿管内潴留尿液导致其扩张。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000073	Ureteral duplication	A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.	输尿管重复	一种发育异常，一侧肾脏通过两根输尿管（而不是一根）连接到膀胱。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000074	Ureteropelvic junction obstruction	Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.	肾盂输尿管连接部梗阻	在肾盂到近端输尿管尿处流受到阻断。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000075	Renal duplication	A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the `kidney` (FMA:7203) is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.	肾重复	先天性泌尿道异常，肾发生重复并分别经由两个独立的肾盂和输尿管下排。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000076	Vesicoureteral reflux	Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.	膀胱输尿管返流	尿液从膀胱异常（反向）流动进入输尿管或达到肾，与输尿管膀胱瓣膜结构异常有关，或存在其他原因。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000077	Abnormality of the kidney	An abnormality of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾脏异常	肾脏的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000078	Abnormality of the genital system	An abnormality of the `genital system` (FMA:7160).	生殖系统异常	生殖系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000079	Abnormality of the urinary system	An abnormality of the `urinary system` (FMA:7159).	泌尿系统异常	泌尿系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000080	Abnormality of genital physiology	An `abnormal` (PATO:0000460) `functionality` (PATO:0001509) of the `genital system` (FMA:7160).	生殖生理异常	生殖系统发生的功能异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000081	Duplicated collecting system	A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney.	集合管系统重复	肾集合管系统的重复。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000083	Renal insufficiency	A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.	肾功能不全	肾功能的降低，肾功能包括尿液的浓缩、廓清废物、维持电解质平衡、维持机体内血压平衡和钙代谢。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000085	Horseshoe kidney	A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.	马蹄肾	由有肾功能的肾实质或纤维组织将左右肾在中线峡部连接起来，呈现马蹄状。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000086	Ectopic kidney	A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.	异位肾	由发育异常导致肾脏不在正常解剖位置。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000089	Renal hypoplasia	`Hypoplasia` (MPATH:133) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾发育不全	肾发育不良。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000090	Nephronophthisis	Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.	肾消耗病	肾皮髓质交界处存在囊肿，伴肾小管间质性纤维化。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000091	Abnormality of the renal tubule	An abnormality of the `renal tubules` (FMA:15627).	肾小管异常	肾小管的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000092	Tubular atrophy	The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.	肾小管萎缩	肾小管形成增厚的冗余基底膜，或与周围未萎缩的小管相比直径减小超过一半。
泌尿生殖系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000093	Proteinuria	Increased levels of protein in the urine.	蛋白尿	尿液中蛋白质水平增加。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000095	Abnormality of the glomerulus	A structural anomaly of the `glomerulus` (FMA:15624).	肾小球异常	肾小球的结构异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000096	Glomerulosclerosis	Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.	肾小球硬化	肾小球内疤痕组织占位。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000097	Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis	Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.	局灶节段性肾小球硬化	在部分（而不是全部）肾小球存在节段性瘢痕组织增加。
生长异常	HP:0000098	Tall stature	A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.	高身材	身高高于该年龄性别预期身高的正常范围。
泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000099	Glomerulonephritis	Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.	肾小球肾炎	肾小球的炎症。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000100	Nephrotic syndrome	Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.	肾病综合征	肾病综合征包含一系列的异常，由肾小球功能障碍所致，伴肾小球毛细血管壁通透性增加而产生明显的蛋白尿。肾病综合征是指严重的肾性蛋白质损失，致蛋白尿、低白蛋白血症、浮肿和高血脂症等一系列临床表现。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000103	Polyuria	An `increased rate` (PATO:0000912) of urine production.	多尿	尿液生成率增加。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000104	Renal agenesis	`Agenesis` (MPATH:57), that is, failure of the `kidney` (FMA:7203) to develop during embryogenesis and development.	肾缺如	肾缺如是指在胚胎形成和发育过程中没有肾脏发育。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000105	Enlarged kidneys	An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.	肾脏增大	肾脏的大小异常增加。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000107	Renal cyst	A fluid filled sac in the kidney.	肾囊肿	肾脏中有充满液体的囊。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000108	Renal corticomedullary cysts	The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.	肾皮髓质交界处囊肿	肾皮质和髓质交界处多发性囊肿。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000110	Renal dysplasia	The presence of `developmental dysplasia` (MPATH:64) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾发育不良	肾脏发育不良。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000111	Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia	Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.	肾小球球旁细胞肥大/增生	肾小球球旁细胞数量增加和体积增大。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000112	Nephropathy	A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.	肾病	非特异性术语​​，通指肾脏的疾病或损伤。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000113	Polycystic kidney dysplasia	The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.	多囊性肾发育不良	双侧肾脏多发囊肿。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000114	Proximal tubulopathy	Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.	近端肾小管病	近端肾小管功能障碍，近端肾小管是从肾小囊（鲍曼囊）通往细尿管袢（亨利袢）的肾单位管道系统的一部分。
泌尿生殖系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000117	Renal phosphate wasting	High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.	肾源性磷酸盐流失	低磷血症时尿液中出现高磷酸盐。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000119	Abnormality of the genitourinary system	The presence of any abnormality of the `genitourinary system` (FMA:280610).	泌尿生殖系统异常	泌尿生殖系统的异常。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000121	Nephrocalcinosis	Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.	肾钙质沉着症	肾钙质沉着症指是钙盐在肾实质的沉积。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0000122	Unilateral renal agenesis	A `unilateral` (PATO:0000634) form of `agenesis` (MPATH:57) of the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	单侧肾缺如	单侧型肾缺如。
泌尿生殖系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000123	Nephritis	The presence of `inflammation` (MPATH:212) affecting the `kidney` (FMA:7203).	肾炎	肾脏出现炎症反应。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000176	Submucous cleft hard palate	Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.	黏膜下硬裂腭	粘膜下硬腭裂以形成口腔顶部的骨性硬腭中间部缺损为特征。可能在触诊硬腭时检查出来。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000185	Cleft soft palate	Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.	软腭裂	软腭（也称为软腭，或肌肉腭）的裂口，为第7周和第12周妊娠之间发生的发育缺陷的结果。软腭裂可导致咽鼓管功能异常，由此导致中耳畸形和听力困难，以及因腭咽闭合不全带来的伴有重鼻音的语言问题。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000201	Pierre-Robin sequence	Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by `micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia)` (HP:0000347), `glossoptosis` (HP:0000162) and `cleft palate` (HP:0000175).	皮埃尔 - 罗宾序列	皮埃尔-罗宾畸形的特点是小下颌（下颌发育不全），舌下垂和腭裂的发育畸形序列。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000202	Oral cleft	The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.	口裂	口腔中有裂口，有唇裂和腭裂两种主要类型。唇裂指上颌和正中鼻突的先天性融合失败而形成在唇部的凹槽或裂缝。腭裂指腭先天性未能正确融合而在口腔顶部形成带槽凹陷或裂缝。唇颚裂可单独或合并发生。最好是每个缺陷分别编码。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000204	Cleft upper lip	A gap in the `upper lip` (FMA:59817). This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.	上唇裂	上唇的间隙。这是胚胎发育过程中唇组织非融合造成的先天性缺陷。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000205	Pursed lips	An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.	钱包状嘴唇	由于嘴唇收缩导致唇周皮肤呈放射状的一种面部畸形。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000206	Glossitis	Inflammation of the tongue.	舌炎	舌头发炎。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000207	Triangular mouth	The presence of a `triangular` (PATO:0001875) form of the `mouth` (FMA:49184).	三角嘴	嘴呈三角形。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000211	Trismus	Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.	牙关紧闭	张口能力受限。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000212	Gingival overgrowth	`Hyperplasia` (MPATH:134) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762, that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.	牙龈增生	牙龈增生即覆盖在牙槽嵴上的软组织变厚。增厚范围从仅包括齿间乳头，到牙龈增生覆盖整个牙冠。
心血管系统异常,头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000214	Lip telangiectasia	`Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the `lips` (FMA:59815).	唇部毛细血管扩张	唇部的毛细血管扩张（即浅表小血管扩张）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000215	Thick upper lip vermilion	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	厚上唇红	上唇中线唇红的高度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看下唇唇红的高度显得增加（主观）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000216	Broad secondary alveolar ridge	#####	宽恒牙槽嵴	#####
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000217	Xerostomia	Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.	口腔干燥	因唾液腺功能障碍导致的口腔黏膜干燥。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000218	High palate	Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).	高腭	腭高大于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）或腭高在第一恒大臼齿处的水平高度超过该牙齿的高度的两倍（主观）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000219	Thin upper lip vermilion	Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).	薄上唇红	上唇中线唇红的高度小于平均值超过2个标准偏差。或者，从正面看上唇唇红的高度显得变短（主观）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000220	Velopharyngeal insufficiency	Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.	腭咽机能不全	腭咽括约肌功能下降，言语时不能把鼻腔与口腔分开。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000221	Furrowed tongue	Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.	沟裂舌	舌头背侧表面上的凹槽加深。
头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000222	Gingival hyperkeratosis	`Hyperkeratosis` (MPATH:154) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	牙龈角化过度	牙龈发生过度角化
神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000223	Abnormality of taste sensation	The taste patients feeling (subjective feeling) is different from normal while eating.	味觉异常	味觉异常是指在饮食时口舌感觉的味道（主观感觉）异于正常人，也可表现为进食无味、味觉减退或味觉完全丧失。
神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000224	Decreased taste sensation	The taste we feeling while eating is closely related to olfaction, vision as well as taste. Decreased taste sensation can be caused by a variety of reasons.	味觉减退	味觉是指食物在人的口腔内对味觉器官化学感受系统的刺激并产生的一种感觉。不同地域的人对味觉的分类不一样。使老人味觉减退的因素有很多，因为食物的滋味不仅来自于舌头的基本味觉，而且与嗅觉、视觉、神经等的作用有着密切的关系。
头部和颈部的异常,血液和造血组织异常	HP:0000225	Gingival bleeding	`Hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) affecting the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	牙龈出血	累及牙龈的出血
心血管系统异常,头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000227	Tongue telangiectasia	`Telangiectasia` (MPATH:476) (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.	舌毛细血管扩张	舌的毛细血管扩张（即舌体的浅表小血管扩张）。
心血管系统异常,头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000228	Oral cavity teleangiectasia	Presence of teleangiectases in the oral cavity.	口腔毛细管扩张	口腔中的毛细血管扩张。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000230	Gingivitis	`Inflammation` (MPATH:212) of the `gingiva` (FMA:59762).	牙龈炎	牙龈发炎。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000232	Everted lower lip vermilion	An abnormal configuration of the `lower lip` (FMA:59818) such that it is turned outward i.e., `everted` (PATO:0001597), with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.	下唇唇红外翻	下唇异常外翻，即从正面可见下唇唇红的内部（通常与牙齿相对）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000233	Thin vermilion border	Reduced width of the &quot;skin of vermilion border region of upper lip&quot; (FMA:312645).	薄嘴唇	上唇唇红区皮肤显得变窄。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000234	Abnormality of the head	An abnormality of the `head` (FMA:7154).	头部异常	头部的异常。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000235	Abnormality of the fontanelles and cranial sutures	Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments ).	囟门和颅缝的异常	囟门（在出生两年内骨化的由厚膜覆盖的区域）和颅缝（颅骨之间由韧带和纤维性关节构成的结缔组织相连形成的缝隙）的任何异常
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000236	Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle	An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.	前囟异常	前囟的任何异常。前囟即颅囟，位于冠状缝和矢状缝的交点。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000237	Small anterior fontanelle	Abnormally decreased size of  the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.	小前囟	#####
神经系统异常	HP:0000238	Hydrocephalus	Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.	脑积水	脑积水是从脑脊液产生到吸收至体循环通路异常导致的脑室系统主动扩张。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000239	Large fontanelles	In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.	大囟门	在新生儿中，两块额骨、两块顶骨和一块枕骨由纤维缝合线连接，形成一个小的后囟和一个较大的菱形前囟。这些区域允许头颅通过产道，以后可增长。出生后囟门逐渐骨化，后囟通常在出生后八周闭合，前囟在出生后9〜16个月时闭合。如果囟门比年龄相符的正常值大，则被诊断为大囟门。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000240	Abnormality of skull size	Any abnormality of the size of the skull.	颅骨的大小异常	颅骨大小的任何异常。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000242	Parietal bossing	Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.	顶骨隆起	顶骨隆起是指在顶骨区明显突出。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000243	Trigonocephaly	Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.	三角头畸形	头颅呈三角形或三角锥形，尖位于额部中线，底位于两侧枕骨连线。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000244	Brachyturricephaly	A skull deformity characterized by a shortening of the anterior-posterior and an elongation of the transverse and vertical skulldiameters,, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.	短尖头畸形	颅骨畸形，呈前后径缩短，垂直径和水平径延长，常合并枕骨区畸形。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000245	Abnormality of the sinuses	Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.	鼻窦异常	鼻旁鼻（颅）窦的异常。鼻窦是头骨和面部的骨头内部与鼻腔相通的充满空气的空间，包括上颌窦，额窦，筛窦，和蝶窦。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000246	Sinusitis	Inflammation of the `paranasal sinuses` (FMA:59679) owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.	鼻窦炎	由于病毒、细菌、真菌感染，过敏或自身免疫反应等原因所造成的鼻窦的炎症。（FMA:59679）
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000248	Brachycephaly	An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `decreased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002042). That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.	短头畸形	头骨形状的异常，其特征为前后直径减小。即头指数大于81％，或头部的前后尺寸（长度）相比宽度显得缩短。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000250	Dense calvaria	An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.	颅盖骨密度过高	颅盖骨骨骼密度的异常增加。
神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000252	Microcephaly	Occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC) less than -3 standard deviations compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597). Alternatively, decreased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).	小头畸形	枕额（头）围（OFC）比年龄匹配的正常标准少3个标准差以上(参见Ross JJ, Frias JL 1977,  PMID:9683597)。或者头盖骨尺寸减小。
神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000253	Progressive microcephaly	Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.	渐进性小头畸形	头围逐渐落后于同年龄和同性别的正常值时，可诊断为渐进性小头畸形。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000255	Acute sinusitis	An `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `sinusitis` (HP:0000246).	急性鼻窦炎	急性鼻窦炎
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000256	Macrocephaly	Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the `cranium` (FMA:46565).	巨头畸形	枕额（头）周长大于年龄和性别相匹配的正常值的第97百分位数。或者头盖骨尺寸显得增大。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000260	Wide anterior fontanel	Enlargement of the `anterior fontanelle` (FMA:75439) with respect to age-dependent norms.	前囟增宽	与相应年龄正常值相比，前囟扩大。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000262	Turricephaly	Tall head relative to width and length.	尖头畸形	头的高度与宽度和长度相比过大。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000263	Oxycephaly	Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.	尖头畸形	尖头畸形（希腊oxus尖锐，kephalos头）是指头颅呈锥形或尖形。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000264	Abnormality of the mastoid	An abnormality of the `mastoid process` (FMA:52872), which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.	乳突异常	乳突的异常。乳突指从颞骨乳突部底面突出的圆锥形突出。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000265	Mastoiditis	A bacterial infection of the mastoid bone. The mastoid bone, which sits behind the ear, consists of air spaces that help drain the middle ear.	乳突炎	乳突骨的细菌感染炎症。乳突骨坐落于耳后，帮助空气从中耳排出。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000267	Cranial asymmetry	Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.	颅骨不对称	#####
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000268	Dolichocephaly	An `abnormality of skull shape` (HP:0002648) characterized by a `increased anterior-posterior diameter` (PATO:0002043), i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.	长头畸形	一种以前-后直径过长为特征的颅骨形状异常，即头骨从面前到脑后的尺寸过长。头颅指数低于76％。或者说，相对于头部宽度，头部前-后长度显得过长。常由矢状缝的过早关闭导致。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000269	Prominent occiput	Increased convexity of the `occiput` (FMA:49187) (posterior part of the skull).	枕骨突出	枕骨（颅骨后部）的凸度增加
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000270	Delayed cranial suture closure	Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.	颅缝闭合延迟	婴儿在出生时通常有两个囟门，菱形前囟在冠状缝和矢状缝交界处，后囟在枕顶骨的交点。后囟通常出生后第8周闭合，前囟平均出生后18个月闭合。本术语适用于的囟门闭合延迟/超出正常年龄。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000271	Abnormality of the face	An abnormality of the `face` (FMA:24728).	脸部异常	脸部的异常
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000272	Malar flattening	Underdevelopment of the malar (frontal) process of the maxilla, appreciated in profile and/or by palpation.	扁平颧突	上颌骨颧（前）突发育落后，通过侧面观察和/或触诊来识别。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000273	Facial grimacing	#####	面部表情痛苦	#####
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000274	Small face	A face that is short (HP:0011219) and narrow (HP:0000275).	小脸	面部既短又窄
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000275	Narrow face	Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).	脸狭窄	两颧间（脸上部）和下颌角间（脸下部）的宽度低于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）;或者脸的上部和下部的宽度显得减小（主观）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000276	Long face	Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).	长脸	面部高度（长度）比平均值高大于2个标准偏差（客观）；或者，面部高度（长度）显得增加（主观）。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000277	Abnormality of the mandible	Any abnormality of the `mandible` (FMA:52748), the bone of the lower jaw.	下颌骨异常	下颌骨的任何异常
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000278	Retrognathia	An abnormality in which the `mandible` (FMA:52748) is `mislocalised posteriorly` (PATO:0001922).	下颌后缩	下颌骨后移所导致的一种畸形
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000280	Coarse facial features	Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.	面容粗糙	眉毛，鼻子，嘴唇，嘴，下巴的外观不精细鲜明，通常是因为圆润和厚重的面部特征或伴有或没有皮下和骨组织增厚的皮肤增厚。
代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000282	Facial edema	#####	面部水肿	#####
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000283	Broad face	Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).	宽脸	双颧间（脸上部）和下颌角间（脸下部）宽度的大于平均值2个标准偏差（客观）;或者脸宽度显得增加（主观）。
	HP:0000284	Abnormality of the ocular region	#####	眼部异常	#####
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000286	Epicanthus	A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.	内眦赘皮	始于上眼睑中部之上，并向下弯覆盖至内眼角前面和侧面的皮肤褶皱。
结缔组织异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000287	Increased facial adipose tissue	An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.	面部脂肪组织增多	面部皮下脂肪组织的量增加。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000288	Abnormality of the philtrum	An abnormality of the `philtrum` (FMA:59819).	人中异常	人中的异常。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000289	Broad philtrum	Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.	宽人中	由正上方唇红边缘测得的人中脊之间的距离大于平均值2个标准偏差以上，或人中脊之间的距离显得增加。

结缔组织异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000292	Loss of facial adipose tissue	Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.	面部脂肪组织丢失	面部正常的皮下脂肪组织失去。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000293	Full cheeks	Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible.	脸颊丰满	颧骨与下颌骨之间软组织更加鼓起或圆润。
头部和颈部的异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000294	Low anterior hairline	Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella.	前发际低	位于中线位置的发际（发际中点）和眉间（鼻根上方位于额骨上的最突出的点）的距离，低于平均值两个标准差以上。也可以理解为发际和眉间之间距离明显缩短。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000295	Doll-like facies	A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin.	娃娃脸	表现为圆脸形，圆脸颊，短鼻子以及相对较小的下巴的独特面部外观。
肌肉组织异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000297	Facial hypotonia	Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).	面部肌张力低下	由面神经（第七脑神经）支配的肌肉张力下降。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000298	Mask-like facies	A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth.	面具般面容	缺乏面部表情，常常表现为瞪眼睛和嘴微张。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000300	Oval face	A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.	卵形脸	稍拉长的椭圆形脸轮廓。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000306	Abnormality of the chin	An abnormality of the `chin` (FMA:46495), i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.	下巴异常	下巴的异常。下巴指面下部下唇以下部分，包括下颌中央突出部位。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000307	Pointed chin	A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin.	尖下巴	由面下部到下巴明显削尖。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000308	Microretrognathia	A form of `developmental hypoplasia` (MPATH:10060) of the `mandible` (FMA:52748) in which the mandible is `mislocalised posteriorly` (PATO:0001922).	小下颌后移	下颌骨发育不全的一种形式，指下颌骨向后错位。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000309	Abnormality of the midface	An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.	面中部异常	面中部的异常。面中部指区域而不是解剖术语。其范围上至眼眶下缘，下至鼻基。它是由上颌骨（上颌）和颧骨形成。传统上，面中部不包括鼻和前颌骨。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000311	Round face	The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.	圆脸	从前方看面部外形较通常圆。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000321	Square face	Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance.	方脸	面部轮廓，如从正面观察，可显示较宽的颜面上部/头颅和颜面下部/下颌骨，外形如一正方形。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000322	Short philtrum	Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.	人中短	鼻基与上唇中线红唇的距离低于平均值超过2个标准偏差，或者，鼻基和上唇中线唇红之间的距离显得缩短。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000331	Short chin	Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.	短下巴	从下唇唇红到下巴最下点的垂直距离减少。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000337	Broad forehead	Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead.	宽前额	前额宽度或前颞间距大于平均值两个标准偏差（客观）;或前额两侧之间的距离显得增加。
肌肉组织异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000338	Hypomimic face	A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.	面具面容	面部皮下肌肉的运动幅度降低，通常与面部皱纹形成减少有关。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000339	Pugilistic facies	Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer.	拳击面容	粗糙的面部特征让人联想起一个拳击手。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000340	Sloping forehead	Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.	额头倾斜	额头的前表面倾斜度大于平均值超过2个标准偏差（客观）;或者从侧面观察额头显得过度向后倾斜。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000341	Narrow forehead	Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).	额头狭窄	前额的宽度或者额颞间距离低于平均值多于两个标准偏差（客观）;或显得狭窄的颞骨间区域（主观）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000343	Long philtrum	Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.	长人中	鼻基及上唇中线之间的距离超过平均值的2个标准偏差，或者鼻基和上唇中线之间的距离显得增加。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000346	Whistling appearance	An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.	吹口哨面容	一种由于嘴唇不断的收缩导致张口减小的面部畸形，病人的嘴唇看起来像在吹口哨。

耳部异常	HP:0000360	Tinnitus	Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.	耳鸣	耳鸣是一种没有外部声刺激却出现声音相关的听觉体验，这种体验常位于耳朵或头颅中。
	HP:0000361	Pulsatile tinnitus (tympanic paraganglioma)	Pulsatile tinnitus related to a tympanic paraganglioma, which is a benign neoplasm of the middle ear.	搏动性耳鸣（鼓室副神经节瘤）	鼓室副神经节瘤（一种中耳良性肿瘤）相关的搏动性耳鸣。
耳部异常	HP:0000362	Otosclerosis	In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.	耳硬化症	在耳硬化症中，不正常的骨组织在镫骨及其周围聚集造成镫骨部分固定。这限制了镫骨运动从而导致耳聋。

耳部异常	HP:0000381	Stapes ankylosis	Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).	镫骨固定	镫骨（中耳中的镫形小骨或听小骨）固定是指先天性或获得性的镫骨关节强直，其与声音传导机制（外耳道、鼓膜及/或中耳听小骨）障碍导致的传导性听力损失相关。

耳部异常	HP:0000400	Macrotia	Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).	巨耳畸形	客观判断耳朵的平均纵长和宽度超过平均值2个标准偏差以上，或主观判断耳廓长度和宽度明显增加。

耳部异常	HP:0000411	Protruding ear	Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).	招风耳	耳朵平面与颞骨乳突部的夹角大于第97年龄百分位数（客观），或者耳轮外缘与乳突处的最大距离点之间距离超过2厘米（目标）。

头部和颈部的异常,血液和造血组织异常	HP:0000421	Epistaxis	Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a `hemorrhage` (MPATH:119) localized in the`nose` (FMA:46472).	鼻衄	鼻出血，指鼻部的流血
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000422	Abnormality of the nasal bridge	Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.	鼻梁异常	鼻梁的异常。鼻梁即鼻的凹陷区域包括鼻根和鼻侧面。它位于眉间和鼻骨下边界之间并侧伸至内眼角。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000426	Prominent nasal bridge	Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.	鼻梁突出	鼻根部向前突出。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000429	Abnormality of the nasal alae	An abnormality of the `Ala of nose` (FMA:59519).	鼻翼异常	鼻翼的异常。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000444	Convex nasal ridge	Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.	凸鼻嵴	鼻脊向连接鼻根和鼻尖的假想线之前弯曲。鼻子经常会同时显得突出和鼻小柱低
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000445	Wide nose	Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.	宽鼻	两侧鼻翼之间的距离大于同年龄平均值超过2个标准偏差，即鼻基宽度和鼻翼之间的宽度显得增加。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000446	Narrow nasal bridge	Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.	鼻梁狭窄	鼻子的骨桥宽度减小。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000447	Pear-shaped nose	#####	梨形鼻	#####
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000448	Prominent nose	Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.	鼻子突出	鼻中隔根部和鼻尖之间的距离大于平均值加两倍标准差，或者，鼻子显得向前突起。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000451	Triangular nasal tip	The presence of a `triangular`  form of the ` mouth `	三角鼻尖	鼻尖呈三角形。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000452	Choanal stenosis	Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).	鼻后孔狭窄	鼻后孔（后鼻孔）异常收窄。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000456	Bifid nasal tip	A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.	双歧鼻尖	鼻尖的分裂。目视可见的有垂直压痕，裂开，或凹陷的鼻尖。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000457	Depressed nasal ridge	Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.	鼻嵴凹陷	由鼻嵴凹陷导致的鼻子不突出。
神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000458	Anosmia	An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.	嗅觉丧失	不能感知气味。这是一个通用术语，描述不能闻到的任何气味，可以是嗅觉过程中任何一部分异常而引起的，这一过程包括把气味物质吸收到覆盖嗅觉上皮的鼻腔粘膜，扩散到纤毛，与嗅觉神经元的受体位点结合，产生神经电冲动，从而感知的气味。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000460	Narrow nose	Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.	鼻子狭窄	鼻翼间距离低于年龄矫正的平均值超过2个标准偏差，或者鼻基宽度显得减小。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000463	Anteverted nares	Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).	鼻孔前翻	观察者与被观察者头部保持法兰克福水平且两人眼睛平齐，在这样的视角下观察到鼻孔朝前。外观表现为朝天鼻（鼻尖上翘）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000464	Abnormality of the neck	An abnormality of the `neck` (FMA:7155).	颈部异常	颈部的异常。

肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000473	Torticollis	Involuntary contractions of the `neck musculature` (FMA:71290) resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.	斜颈	颈部肌肉不自主收缩导致头部运动异常或位置异常。
头部和颈部的异常,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0000474	Thickened nuchal skin fold	A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (pmid:16100637).	颈部皮肤皱褶冗赘	胎儿颈后皮肤厚度增厚。通过胎儿头部横断位位于透明隔腔和丘脑水平，倾斜向后包括小脑处测量皱褶。测量取自胎儿中线处，枕骨中部外侧缘至皮肤最外侧。在18至24周大于或等于6mm，或16至18周大于或等于5毫米可认为测量值显著。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000475	Broad neck	Increased side-to-side width of the neck.	宽颈	颈部一侧到另一侧宽度增加。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000476	Cystic hygroma	A cystic lymphatic lesion of the `neck` (FMA:7155).	囊状水瘤	颈部囊性淋巴病变。

眼部异常	HP:0000481	Abnormality of the cornea	Any abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238), which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.	角膜异常	#####
眼部异常	HP:0000482	Microcornea	A congenital abnormality of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.	小角膜	角膜的先天性异常（FMA:58238），其中角膜和眼睛的眼前段都小于正常。角膜的水平直径甚至在成年期没有达到10毫米。
眼部异常	HP:0000483	Astigmatism	Astigmatism describes a refractive error  characterized by a difference in the horizontal and vertical  curvature of the cornea.	散光	散光为角膜的水平和垂直曲率不同导致的屈光不正。
眼部异常	HP:0000484	Hyperopic astigmatism	A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.	远视散光	散光的一种形式，其中一条子午线是远视，而垂直的另一条线上没有屈光不正。
眼部异常	HP:0000485	Megalocornea	An enlargement of the `cornea` (FMA:58238) with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.	巨角膜	角膜扩大，但清晰度和功能正常。 巨角膜的诊断标准为出生时角膜水平直径12毫米或更大，或两岁后角膜水平直径达13mm或以上。
眼部异常	HP:0000486	Strabismus	Strabismus (also known as squint) is a condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other.	斜视	斜视（也称为斜视）是指两只眼睛视物方向不平行。
眼部异常	HP:0000487	Congenital strabismus	Congenital strabismus	先天性斜视	出生后即发生的斜视。
眼部异常	HP:0000488	Retinopathy	Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.	视网膜病变	视网膜的任何非炎性疾病。保留此非特异性术语​​是因为它在文献中广泛使用，但新的注解应注明精确的视网膜异常类型。
头部和颈部的异常,眼部异常	HP:0000490	Deeply set eye	An `eye` (FMA:54448) that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.	眼睛深陷	眼睛陷入面部平面的深度超过正常状态。
免疫系统异常,眼部异常	HP:0000491	Keratitis	Inflammation of the cornea.	角膜炎	角膜的炎症。

眼部异常	HP:0000495	Recurrent corneal erosions	The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.	复发性角膜糜烂	存在复发性角膜上皮糜烂。虽然大部分角膜上皮缺损很快愈合，某些患者可能出现反复的溃疡。

眼部异常	HP:0000505	Visual impairment	Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.	视觉障碍	视觉障碍指由于疾病、外伤、先天或退行性因素导致的不同程度的视力丧失，视物能力严重受限，需要额外的辅助。传统方法如屈光矫正、药物、手术等无法恢复丧失的视力。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000506	Telecanthus	Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.	内眦距过宽	内眦距离大于平均值超过两个标准偏差（客观）；或两眼内眦之间的距离显得增加。
眼部异常	HP:0000508	Ptosis	The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).	上睑下垂	上睑缘比正常位置低3毫米或更多，覆盖虹膜的上部分（客观角度）;或者遮蔽一部分进入瞳孔的光线（主观角度）。

眼部异常	HP:0000511	Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy	A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.	垂直性核上性凝视麻痹	核上性凝视麻痹在垂直方向无法正常视物，是脑损伤的结果。眼球随意运动丧失，但是由于脑干仍然完好，所有的反射共轭眼球运动正常。
眼部异常	HP:0000512	Abnormal electroretinogram	Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.	视网膜电流图异常	通过视网膜电流图检测发现的视网膜中各种类型细胞的电反应异常。

眼部异常	HP:0000518	Cataract	A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline `lens` (FMA:58241) of the eye or in its `capsule` (FMA:58881).	白内障	白内障是指晶状体或晶状体囊膜的不透明或混浊。
眼部异常	HP:0000519	Congenital cataract	A congenital `cataract` (HP:0000518).	先天性白内障	出生后即发现的白内障`（HP:0000518）。
头部和颈部的异常,眼部异常	HP:0000520	Proptosis	An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.	眼球突出	眼球向前突起于面部平面的程度远大于正常状态。
眼部异常	HP:0000522	Alacrima	Absence of tear secretion.	无泪	缺乏泪液分泌。
眼部异常	HP:0000523	Subcapsular cataract	A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the `capsule of the lens` (FMA:58881).	囊下白内障	#####
心血管系统异常,体壁的异常,头部和颈部的异常,眼部异常	HP:0000524	Conjunctival telangiectasia	The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.	结膜毛细血管扩张	球结膜的粘膜表面出现扩张的小血管（约0.5〜1.0毫米）。
眼部异常	HP:0000525	Abnormality of the iris	An abnormality of the `iris` (FMA:58235), which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.	虹膜异常	在虹膜上（FMA:58235）的异常，虹膜是位于角膜和晶状体之间的色素肌肉组织，虹膜中间的开口称为瞳孔。
眼部异常	HP:0000526	Aniridia	Congenital absence of the `iris` (FMA:58235).	无虹膜	先天性缺少虹膜（FMA:58235）。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000537	Epicanthus inversus	A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.	下内眦赘皮	始于下眼睑中部之下，并向上弯覆盖至内眼角前面和侧面的皮肤褶皱。
眼部异常	HP:0000538	Pseudopapilledema	Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.	假性视乳头水肿	#####
眼部异常	HP:0000539	Abnormality of refraction	An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.	屈光异常	正常情况下，光线经眼球聚焦在视网膜上产生一清晰的影像，这一过程出现异常为屈光异常。
眼部异常	HP:0000540	Hypermetropia	An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.	远视	屈光的一种，其特征是可以看清远处的物体，而近处的物体出现模糊。
眼部异常	HP:0000541	Retinal detachment	Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.	视网膜脱离	视网膜内层（神经视网膜）与色素上皮层分离。
眼部异常	HP:0000542	Impaired ocular adduction	Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.	眼内收障碍	眼睛向鼻子方向转动的能力下降。
眼部异常	HP:0000543	Optic disc pallor	A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.	视盘苍白	视盘灰黄色的颜色变浅（视神经乳头在视网膜的部位）。视盘通常呈粉红色，中央凹陷微黄色。

眼部异常	HP:0000545	Myopia	An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.	近视	屈光异常的一种，其特征是看近处物体清楚，而远处的物体模糊。

眼部异常	HP:0000557	Buphthalmos	Buphthalmos refers to a congenital open-angle glaucoma of the eye. The term buphthalmos (from Greek &#39;bous&#39; or ox and &#39;ophthalmos&#39; or eye) is descriptive of an enlarged eyeglobe resulting from increased intraocular pressure. The eyeglobe is especially prone to distension in newborns and infants because its collagen filaments are not as rigid as in adults and may easily be stretched.	先天性开角型青光眼	#####

眼部异常	HP:0000640	Gaze-evoked nystagmus	Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.	凝视诱发眼震	眼球震颤在向右或向左凝视的时候变得明显。
眼部异常	HP:0000641	Dysmetric saccades	The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.	Dysmetric 扫视	眼球扫视时的控制器信号有两个组成部分:脉冲控制眼球从一点到另一点快速移动，之后保持眼睛在该位置不动。当脉冲和凝视不匹配时，dysmetric再注视即发生了。
眼部异常	HP:0000642	Red-green dyschromatopsia	Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.	红绿色觉障碍	识别红色和绿色色调困难。
神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000643	Blepharospasm	A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.	眼睑痉挛	影响眼睑和额头的肌肉局部肌张力障碍，伴有双眼睑不自主复发性痉挛。
眼部异常	HP:0000646	Amblyopia	Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.	弱视	无法利用镜片矫正的视力敏度下降，眼球和视觉通路无可见的解剖学缺陷。
眼部异常	HP:0000647	Sclerocornea	A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.	角膜巩膜化	先天性异常，其中部分或全部的角膜获得巩膜的特性，从而导致角膜混浊。
眼部异常	HP:0000648	Optic atrophy	`Atrophy` (MPATH:127) of the `optic nerve` (FMA:50863). Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.	视神经萎缩	视神经萎缩是由于视网膜神经节细胞轴突死亡所致，表现为眼底检查中视神经乳头颜色灰暗。
眼部异常	HP:0000649	Abnormality of vision evoked potentials	An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.	视觉诱发电位异常	视觉诱发的电位异常（VEP），是短暂的视觉刺激启动的电势，在视觉皮层外方的头皮上记录。
眼部异常	HP:0000650	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	Reduced amplitude of pattern visual evoked potentials	多导视觉诱发电位振幅降低	多导视觉诱发的电位振幅降低
眼部异常	HP:0000651	Diplopia	Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.	复视	复视是指一个对象被感知为两个图像。

神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000658	Eyelid apraxia	Eyelid apraxia is manifested as involuntary levator muscle suppression and orbicularis oculi muscle inhibition. It is one of the typical signs of Parkinson's disease in the elderly.	眼睑失用症	不自主的提睑肌抑制及眼轮匝肌抑制。是老年人帕金森病的典型体征之一。
眼部异常	HP:0000659	Peters anomaly	A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.	Peters 综合征	眼前段异常的一种综合征，前房异常缺失，通常表现为中央，中央旁，或完全的角膜混浊。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000689	Dental malocclusion	Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.	牙齿错位咬合	牙齿错位咬合指牙齿咬合或对齐的异常，以及上下牙齿契合方式的异常，从而导致牙齿排列过挤或咬合模式异常。

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0000691	Microdontia	`Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. 神经系统异常	HP:0000707	Abnormality of the nervous system	An abnormality of the `nervous system` (FMA:7157).	神经系统异常	在`神经系统`的异常（FMA:7157）。

神经系统异常	HP:0000709	Psychosis	A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs.	精神病	一种表现为人格和思维模式改变的疾病，常伴有幻觉和妄想。
神经系统异常	HP:0000710	Hyperorality	A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth.	口欲亢进	用口腔检查物体的一种倾向或冲动。
神经系统异常	HP:0000711	Restlessness	Restlessness is manifested as an inability to be still, quiet, at peace or comfortable.	躁动	躁动表现为难以保持静止、安静、平和、舒适的状态。
神经系统异常	HP:0000712	Emotional lability	The relative stability of emotion is poor. The symptom is seen most frequently in brain organic psychosis while the mechanisms remain elusive. And it is lack of special method of therapy.	情绪不稳	情绪不稳指患者的情绪在主、客观影响下易于诱发，易于转化和易于消退。情绪的相对稳定性差。产生机制目前不明，情绪不稳多见于脑器质性精神障碍。无特殊治疗。
神经系统异常	HP:0000713	Agitation	Agitation is a violent and transitory affective disorder, including irritability, impatience or anger.	躁动	一种剧烈但持续较短的情感障碍，包括烦恼、急躁或愤怒。可见于疲劳、慢性疼痛，或作为情感异常的临床特征，发生于老年性、脑外伤、癫痫和情感性精神障碍。
神经系统异常	HP:0000716	Depression	A condition characterized by pervasive dysphoric mood, loss of interests, and inability to experience pleasure.	抑郁	以普遍烦躁不安的情绪，失去兴趣，高兴不起来为特征的状态。
神经系统异常	HP:0000717	Autism	Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	孤独症	孤独症是一种神经发育障碍，主要表现为社交能力受损、兴趣狭窄和行为刻板。婴幼儿期起病，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄。
神经系统异常	HP:0000718	Aggressive behavior	Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself.	攻击性行为	攻击性行为可以表现为言语攻击、对目标的物理攻击、对人的身体攻击、并且还可能包括自我攻击。
神经系统异常	HP:0000719	Inappropriate behavior	Inappropriate behavior	不适宜行为	不合时宜的行为。
神经系统异常	HP:0000720	Mood swings	An exaggeration of emotional affects such as laughing crying, or yawning beyond what the person feels.	情绪波动	扩大的情绪反应，如超出个人体验的大笑大哭，或打哈欠。
神经系统异常	HP:0000721	Lack of spontaneous play	自发性游戏的缺乏。自发性游戏具有自由、随意的特点，往往最能体现孩子们自己的游戏意愿，并表现出孩子们奇特的想象力和创造力。	自发性游戏缺乏	自发性游戏的缺乏。自发性游戏具有自由、随意的特点，往往最能体现孩子们自己的游戏意愿，并表现出孩子们奇特的想象力和创造力。
神经系统异常	HP:0000722	Obsessive-compulsive behavior	Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV).	强迫行为	复发性强迫观念或强迫行为导致严重的耗时现象（患者每天需要浪费1小时以上），或者引起明显的痛苦或损伤（DSM-IV）。
神经系统异常	HP:0000723	Restrictive behavior	Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities.	限制性行为	行为特点是不正常的限制，仅有少量的兴趣和活动。
神经系统异常	HP:0000725	Psychotic episodes	The episodes of psychotic	精神病发作	精神病的发作。精神病指严重的心理障碍，患者的认识、情感、意志、动作行为等心理活动均可出现持久的明显的异常；不能正常的学习、工作、生活等；动作行为难以被一般人理解；在病态心理的支配下，有自杀或攻击、伤害他人的动作行为。
神经系统异常	HP:0000726	Dementia	A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.	认知障碍	整体认知能力下降不能满足正常的社会或职业功能。痴呆标志着先前存在的认知能力丧失，通常在成人，可以影响记忆，思维，语言，判断和行为。
神经系统异常	HP:0000727	Frontal lobe dementia	Frontal lobe dementia (FLD) is characterised clinically by personality changes and a progressive speech disorder finally leading to mutism. In the course of the disease also other neurological syndromes may occur such as parkinsonism, a partial Kluver-Bucy-syndrome or a degeneration of motoneurons (FLD + MND). The clinical diagnosis of FLD is supported by functional (SPECT) and morphological (CT, MRI) investigations.	额叶痴呆	额叶痴呆（FLD）以人格改变和进行性言语障碍为主要特征，最终可导致缄默。在疾病进展过程中，还可伴发其它神经综合征，如：帕金森综合征，部分Kluver-Bucy综合征或运动神经元的退化（FLD + MND）。 FLD可通过功能（SPECT）和形态学（CT，MRI）检查进行诊断。
神经系统异常	HP:0000728	Impaired ability to form peer relationships	The ability to form a peer relationship is weak.	同伴关系建立能力障碍	形成同伴关系的能力减弱。
神经系统异常	HP:0000729	Autistic behavior	A disorder beginning in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).	自闭症行为	婴幼儿期出现的异常，它的特点是社会互动和沟通能力明显异常或发育障碍，活动和兴趣显著受限。该病的临床表现差异很大，取决于个体的发育水平和实际年龄（DSM-IV）。
神经系统异常	HP:0000732	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals	恪守程序或习惯	恪守程序或习惯。
神经系统异常	HP:0000733	Stereotypic behavior	A repetitive behaviour that does not serve an observable goal. In general the movements are not aimed at the environment, but at the person itself. Stereotypical behaviour is seen especially in children with sensory, intellectual and/or cognitive handicaps.	刻板行为	重复的无目的性的行为。总的来讲活动不是针对环境，但在人本身。刻板的行为，在伴有感官、智力和/或认知障碍的儿童尤为常见。
神经系统异常	HP:0000734	Disinhibition	A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.	脱抑制	缺乏约束表现在几个方面，包括无视社会规范，冲动，风险评估能力差。
神经系统异常	HP:0000735	Impaired social interactions	Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.	社会交往障碍	社会交往困难，其特征性损害如目光接触，微笑，适当的面部表情和身体姿势，且难以形成的同伴关系和建立友谊。
神经系统异常	HP:0000736	Short attention span	Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.	注意力短暂	注意力降低特点是注意力分散和冲动性，但不一定满足注意缺陷多动障碍的诊断标准。
神经系统异常	HP:0000737	Irritability	Agitation is a violent and transitory affective disorder, including irritability, impatience or anger.	易激惹	一种剧烈但持续较短的情感障碍，包括烦恼、急躁或愤怒。可见于疲劳、慢性疼痛，或作为情感异常的临床特征，发生于老年性、脑外伤、癫痫和情感性精神障碍。
神经系统异常	HP:0000738	Hallucinations	Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.	幻觉	在有意识的、清醒状态下，缺乏真实的外界刺激的一种感觉，因此他们是生动的、实质性的、并存在于外部客观空间。

内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000825	Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) combined with a `decreased concentration` (PATO:0001163) of `glucose` (CHEBI:17234) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	高胰岛素性低血糖	血中 `胰岛素` (PRO:000009054)  的`浓度升高` (PATO:0001162)伴有`葡萄糖glucose` (CHEBI:17234) `浓度降低` 。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000826	Precocious puberty	The onset of secondary sexual characteristics before a normal age. Although it is difficult to define normal age ranges because of the marked variation with which puberty begins in normal children, precocious puberty can be defined as the onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls or 9 years in boys.	性早熟	指在正常年龄之前出现第二性征。尽管正常儿童青春期开始的年龄差别很大导致“正常年龄”难以界定，通常将性早熟定义为男孩9岁或者女孩8岁之前开始青春期发育。

神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000830	Anterior hypopituitarism	A condition of reduced function of the pituitary gland characterized by decreased secretion of one or more of the pituitary hormones growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, prolactin, luteinizing hormone, and follicle-stimulating hormone.	垂体前叶功能减退症	垂体前叶功能减退产生的症状,表现为一种或多种垂体激素分泌减少, 如生长激素，促甲状腺激素，促肾上腺皮质激素，泌乳素，黄体生成素和卵泡刺激素。
内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000831	Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus	A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as will as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.	胰岛素抵抗性糖尿病	糖尿病的一种，其致病原因不是由于缺乏胰岛素，而是由于胰岛素的靶组织如肌肉，脂肪和肝细胞等丧失对胰岛素的反应。这种类型的糖尿病通常在空腹和餐后表现为血中葡萄糖浓度和血清胰岛素水平都升高。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000832	Primary hypothyroidism	A type of "hypothyroidism" (HP:0000821) that results from a defect in the "thyroid gland" (FMA:9603).	原发性甲状腺功能减退症	一种由于甲状腺缺陷而导致的甲状腺功能低下(HP:0000821)。
代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000833	Glucose intolerance	#####	葡萄糖不耐受	#####
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000834	Abnormality of the adrenal glands	Abnormality of the "adrenal glands" (FMA:9604), i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.	肾上腺异常	肾上腺的异常，即位于肾脏顶端的内分泌腺体的异常。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000835	Adrenal hypoplasia	Developmental hypoplasia of the "adrenal glands" (FMA:9604).	肾上腺发育不良	肾上腺的发育不良。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000836	Hyperthyroidism	An abnormality of thyroid physiology (HP:0002926) characterized by refers to excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones "thyroxine" (CHEBI:30660) (i.e., T4) and/or "3,3&#39;,5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion" (CHEBI:533015) (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).	甲状腺功能亢进症	甲状腺生理(HP:0002926)的一种异常，表现为甲状腺激素分泌过多，如甲状腺素（T4）和／或三碘甲腺原氨酸（T3）。
神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000837	Gonadotropin excess	Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.	促性腺激素增多	垂体前叶产生过多的促性腺激素（FSH，LH）。
神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常,生长异常	HP:0000839	Pituitary dwarfism	A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.	垂体性侏儒症	一种比例正常但矮小的身材，与垂体功能异常有关，这种异常或者只是生长激素的分泌不足，或者是全垂体机能减退，即所有垂体前叶激素分泌不足。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000840	Adrenogenital syndrome	Adrenogenital syndrome is also known as congenital adrenal hyperplasia, which results from disorders of steroid hormone production in the adrenal glands leading to a deficiency of cortisol. The pituitary gland reacts by increased secretion of corticotropin, which in turn causes the adrenal glands to overproduce certain intermediary hormones which have testosterone-like effects.	肾上腺性征异常综合征	肾上腺性征异常综合征也称为先天性肾上腺增生，由于肾上腺中类固醇激素产生失调导致皮质醇不足，引起垂体促肾上腺皮质激素分泌增多，从而导致肾上腺一些具有雄激素作用的中间产物产生过量。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000841	Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system	An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.	肾素-血管紧张素系统亢进	肾素-血管紧张素系统活性异常增加，通过增加血容量和收缩血管引起高血压。
内分泌系统异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000842	Hyperinsulinemia	An `increased concentration` (PATO:0001162) of `insulin` (PRO:000009054) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	高胰岛素血症	`血`中 (FMA:9670)`胰岛素` (PRO:000009054)`浓度升高` (PATO:0001162)异常。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000843	Hyperparathyroidism	Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.	甲状旁腺功能亢进症	甲状旁腺产生甲状旁腺激素（PTH）过量。
神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000845	Growth hormone excess	Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.	生长激素增多	肢端肥大症是由于在骨骺已闭合的人中脑垂体产生过多生长激素引起的一种状态，主要引起肢体远端部分的增大。包括颅骨周长增加，鼻子变宽，舌头肿大，面部特征变得粗糙，下颌骨过度增长，而牙齿变得分开。手指和脚趾的厚度增加。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000846	Adrenal insufficiency	Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.	肾上腺功能不全	由于肾上腺腺体本身的缺陷，导致其产生的类固醇激素（主要是皮质醇）不足。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000847	Abnormality of renin-angiotensin system	An abnormality of the "renin-angiotensin system" (FMA:74787).	肾素-血管紧张素系统异常	肾素-血管紧张素系统的异常。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000848	Increased circulating renin level	An increased level of "renin" (PRO:000013883) in the "blood" (FMA:9670).	血肾素水平升高	血液循环中肾素水平升高。

内分泌系统异常	HP:0000851	Congenital hypothyroidism	A type of "hypothyroidism" (HP:0000821) with "congenital onset" (HP:0003577).	先天性甲状腺功能减退症	一种先天性发病(HP:0003577)的甲状腺功能减退症(HP:0000821)。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000852	Pseudohypoparathyroidism	A condition characterized by resistance to the action of parathyroid hormone, in which there is hypocalcemia, hyperphosphatemia, and (appropriately) high levels of parathyroid hormone.	假性甲状旁腺功能减退症	此症特点是对甲状旁腺激素的作用失去敏感性，导致低血钙，高血磷和（相对）高浓度的甲状旁腺激素。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000853	Goiter	An enlargement of the "thyroid gland" (FMA:9603).	甲状腺肿	甲状腺腺体的增大。

代谢紊乱/稳态失衡	HP:0000855	Insulin resistance	`Increased resistance` (PATO:0001650) towards `insulin` (PRO:000009054), that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.	胰岛素抵抗	`增加resistance`（PATO:0001650）朝向`insulin`（PRO:000009054），即，胰岛素在降低血糖水平减少的效果。

神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000863	Central diabetes insipidus	A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.	中枢性尿崩症	由于下丘脑分泌血管加压素（AVP）缺陷引起的尿崩症。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000864	Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis	Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that  hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.	下丘脑-垂体轴异常	垂体（也称为脑下垂体）的异常，垂体是在脑底部从下丘脑的底端突出的一个内分泌腺。垂体分泌的激素有促肾上腺皮质激素ACTH、促甲状腺激素TSH、催乳素PRL、生长激素GH、内啡肽、卵泡刺激素FSH、黄体生成素LH、催产素、抗利尿激素。垂体前叶的激素分泌受到下丘脑激素的严格控制，而垂体后叶基本上是下丘脑的延伸，所以下丘脑和垂体可被认为是一个功能单元。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000866	Euthyroid multinodular goiter	#####	甲状腺功能正常结节性甲状腺肿	#####
内分泌系统异常	HP:0000867	Secondary hyperparathyroidism	Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.	继发性甲状旁腺功能亢进症	继发性甲状旁腺亢进症指在甲状旁腺激素过量产生的同时伴有低血钙症。

神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000870	Prolactin excess	The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.	泌乳激素过多	指泌乳素血中水平异常升高。泌乳素是一种由垂体前叶分泌的蛋白质激素，影响乳腺发育及怀孕期的泌乳。
神经系统异常,内分泌系统异常	HP:0000871	Panhypopituitarism	A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).	全垂体功能减退	垂体功能缺损影响所有垂体前叶激素（生长激素，促甲状腺激素，卵泡刺激素，黄体生成素，促肾上腺皮质激素，和泌乳素）。

内分泌系统异常	HP:0000873	Diabetes insipidus	A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).	尿崩症	一种过量饮水伴多尿，低渗尿（稀释性）的状态。尿崩症可能是由于血管加压素（AVP）分泌缺陷（中枢或神经性尿崩症）或肾脏对AVP的反应缺陷（肾性尿崩症）造成。

骨骼系统异常	HP:0000927	Abnormality of skeletal maturation	The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.	骨骼成熟异常	自胎儿至青春期，骨架的骨头的大小、形状和钙化发生一系列特征性改变。这个过程中的异常包括骨骼成熟的延迟或加速，或一部分而非所有骨头偏离预期的成熟模式。

结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0000934	Chondrocalcinosis	Radiographic evidence of articular calcification that represent calcium pyrophosphate depositions in soft tissue surrounding joints and at the insertions of tendons near joints (Entheses/Sharpey fibers) .	软骨钙质沉着症	关节钙化的影像学证据表明，关节周围软组织及近关节处肌腱附着点有焦磷酸钙沉积。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0000935	Thickened cortex of long bones	Abnormal thickening of the cortex of long bones.	长骨骨皮质增厚	长骨的骨皮质异常增厚。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0000938	Osteopenia	Osteopenia refers to a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD) below normal peak BMD but not low enough to be classified as osteoporosis. According to the WHO, osteopenia is characterized by a value of BMD more than 1 standard deviation below the young adult mean, but less than 2 standard deviations below this value.	骨质减少	骨质减少是指在骨矿物质密度的（BMD）低于正常峰骨密度但不低到足以被归类为骨质疏松症。根据世界卫生组织，骨质减少的特征在于骨密度值比年轻成年人平均值低1个标准差以上，但差距小于2个标准偏差。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0000939	Osteoporosis	Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO, osteoporosis is characterized by a value of BMD 2.5 standard deviations or more below the young adult mean.	骨质疏松	骨质疏松症是一种全身骨骼疾病，其特征为低骨密度和骨组织的微结构退化与骨脆性随之增加。根据世界卫生组织，骨质疏松症的特征在于骨密度值比年轻成年人平均值低2.5个标准差以上。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0000940	Abnormal diaphysis morphology	An abnormalstructure of the diaphysis（the main shaft of a long bone）.	骨干形态异常	骨干（长骨主要中轴部分）的结构异常。

体壁的异常	HP:0000957	Cafe-au-lait spot	Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.	牛奶咖啡斑	牛奶咖啡斑指的是边缘光滑，颜色介于浅棕色至深棕色之间的色素过度沉着性病变，大小因年龄而异，成年人的皮损直径在1.5厘米以上，儿童则在0.5厘米以上。

体壁的异常	HP:0000962	Hyperkeratosis	Hyperkeratosis is thickening of the outer layer of the skin, the stratum corneum, which is composed of large, polyhedral, plate-like envelopes filled with keratin which are the dead cells that have migrated up from the stratum granulosum.	角化过度	角化过度是由皮肤最外层的角质层异常增厚所致，角质层是由大量从颗粒层退化的充满角蛋白的多面扁平状角质细胞构成。
体壁的异常	HP:0000963	Thin skin	Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.	皮肤变薄	皮肤的厚度降低，通常和皮肤的弹性和柔软度缺失有关。
体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0000964	Eczema	Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding.	湿疹	湿疹是皮炎的一种表现，这个术语可用于很多皮肤病变，且可能与大量潜在因素相关。湿疹的皮损呈多形性，可包括干燥伴反复发生的红色皮疹、水肿、干燥伴瘙痒、结痂、剥落、水泡、裂隙、渗血或出血。
心血管系统异常,体壁的异常	HP:0000965	Cutis marmorata	A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.	大理石样皮肤	因皮肤毛细血管扩张和静脉淤血，皮肤出现紫色（表现为红蓝色）围绕中央苍白区呈网状改变，大理石样皮肤又称网状青斑，常发生在下肢、手臂和躯干，在冬季病情加重。

This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.	瘀点	瘀点是针尖大小的红色或紫色的斑点，类似红疹，是皮肤或粘膜下毛细血管破裂浅表出血的表现。瘀点一般有发生出血的倾向。

心血管系统异常,体壁的异常,血液和造血组织异常	HP:0000978	Bruising susceptibility	An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.	瘀斑易感性	瘀斑（青肿）指的是由于血液从破裂的血管逸入组织而引起的皮肤变色。瘀斑易感性指的是瘀伤易感性的异常增加。病例报道中发现其相应的表型异常通常表现为无外伤但出现频繁的青紫和瘀斑。

They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.	紫癜	紫癜（源自拉丁语:purpura，意为“紫色”）是一种触压不褪色的皮肤紫红色斑。通常由皮下出血引起。由于毛细血管脆性增加而发展成紫癜。紫癜比瘀点大。

体壁的异常	HP:0001065	Striae distensae	Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.	萎缩纹	皮肤表现为红色、较薄的凹陷性萎缩带。初起为粉红色的线状萎缩，接着，线状拉长且颜色变为淡红或略带紫色，最后，表现为白色的与皮纹方向平行的凹陷性萎缩带。萎缩纹最常发生在弹性较大的部位，如腰部、臀部、大腿、胸部、腹部和肩部。

眼部异常	HP:0001083	Ectopia lentis	Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.	晶状体异位	晶状体的错位。晶状体的局部位移（或错位）被称为晶状体的半脱位，而一个完整的位移被称为晶状体的脱位。晶状体脱位是晶状体完全脱出晶状体窝，位于前房，玻璃体或视网膜上。如果晶状体部分错位，但仍然包含在晶体空间内，则它被称为半脱位。
眼部异常	HP:0001084	Corneal arcus	A hazy, grayish-white ring about 2 mm in width located close to but separated from the limbus (the corneoscleral junction). Corneal arcus generally occurs bilaterally, and is related to lipid deposition in the cornea. Corneal arcus can occur in elderly persons as a part of the aging process but may be associated with hypercholesterolemia in people under the age of 50 years.	角膜环	角膜缘（角巩膜交界处）的朦胧的，灰白色的约2毫米宽的环形带。角膜环一般在双侧均发生，并与角膜脂质沉积相关。角膜环可发生于老年人，是衰老过程的一部分，也可发生于50岁以下患有高胆固醇血症的人。
眼部异常	HP:0001085	Papilledema	Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.	视乳头水肿	乳头水肿指继发于任何导致脑脊髓液压力增高的因素，视盘发生水肿（肿胀）。

Keratoconjunctivitis sicca often results in a scratchy or sandy sensation (foreign body sensation) in the eyes, and may also be associated with itching, inability to produce tears, photosensitivity, redness, pain, and difficulty in moving the eyelids.	干燥性角结膜炎	干眼可由相关的泪膜成分（水，粘蛋白，或脂质）缺乏，眼睑异常，或上皮异常所致。干燥性角结膜炎通常导致眼睛内出现划痕或砂砾样的感觉（异物感），可同时伴有瘙痒，泪少，对光敏感，发红，疼痛和眼睑移动困难。
