头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001144	Orbital cyst	Presence of a cyst in the region of the orbita. Orbital cysts can be derived from epithelial or glandular tissue within or surrounding the orbit (lacrimal glands, salivary glands, conjunctival, oral, nasal, or sinus epithelium).	眼眶囊肿	眼眶区域的囊肿。眼眶囊肿可从眼眶内或周围的上皮或腺组织（泪腺，唾液腺，结膜，口腔，鼻腔，鼻窦或上皮）衍生。
	HP:0001145	Chorioretinopathy	Chorioretinopathy	脉络膜视网膜病变	发生于脉络膜视网膜的病变
眼部异常	HP:0001146	Pigmentary retinal degeneration	Pigmentary retinal degeneration	色素性视网膜变性	色素性视网膜变性。
眼部异常	HP:0001147	Retinal exudate	Fluid which has escaped from retinal bllod vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina.	视网膜渗出	视网膜血管中含有高浓度脂质，蛋白质和细胞碎片的液体渗出，视网膜表面呈现典型的反射性、明亮、白色或乳白色的彩色外观。
眼部异常	HP:0001149	Lattice corneal dystrophy	The presence of fine, branching linear opacities in Bowman&#39;s layer in the central area that may spread to the periphery in the clinical course. The deep corneal stroma may be involved but the process does not reach Descemet&#39;s membrane. Recurrent corneal erosion may occur. Histologic examination reveals amyloid deposits in the collagen fibers of the cornea.	格子样角膜营养不良	角膜上Bowman层出现细小分枝状的浑浊，随病程进展可能从中央部扩散到周边。病变可能累及深角膜基质，但不会影响Descemet膜，可能会经常性出现角膜糜烂。组织学检查显示在角膜中出现胶原纤维淀粉样蛋白沉积物。
	HP:0001150	Choroidal sclerosis	Choroidal sclerosis is a descriptive term applied to the ophthalmoscopic appearance of prominent white choroidal vessels in which the blood columns are not seen or are sheathed by white lines.	脉络膜硬化	脉络膜硬化是一种描述性术语，用于描述眼底检查中不能看到脉络膜血管或脉络膜血管有白线护套。
眼部异常	HP:0001151	Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit	An `abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit` (HP:0000617) characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects.	水平平滑追随眼动受损	眼部平滑追踪功能出现异常（HP:0000617），其特征为追踪水平移动物体的能力发生损害。
眼部异常	HP:0001152	Saccadic smooth pursuit	An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.	扫视追求平稳运动异常	#####
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0001153	Septate vagina	The presence of a vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication. The septum is longitudinal in the majority of cases.	阴道纵膈	阴道存在隔膜，在大多数病例隔膜是纵向的，故产生了两个阴道。
肢体异常	HP:0001155	Abnormality of the hand	An abnormality affecting one or both hands.	手异常	影响到一只手或双手的异常。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001156	Brachydactyly syndrome	Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used to describe a series of Mendelian diseases characterized by distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here, however, it is preferable to described the observed phenotypic abnormalities precisely.	短指畸形综合征	指（趾）与手/脚不成比例的短小。短指用来描述了一系列具有明显缩短的指（趾）模式（短指类型A-E）的孟德尔疾病，也是这里使用的释义。但是它更适合精确描述所观察到的表型异常。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001159	Syndactyly	Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are revered to as &quot;bony&quot; syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as &quot;symphalangism&quot;.	并指（趾）畸形	手指或脚趾间出现蹼或融合，可以仅涉及软组织或包括骨结构。发生在桡尺轴线的骨性融合被称为“骨性并指”。手指或脚趾在近-远轴的骨头融合称为“关节粘连”。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001161	Hand polydactyly	A kind of `polydactyly` (HP:0010442) characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.	多指	一种多指（趾）类型（HP:0010442），特点是存在额外的手指。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001162	Postaxial hand polydactyly	Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand (that is, on the side with the fifth finger).	轴后多指畸形	额外的手指位于手尺侧（即第五指的一侧）。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001163	Abnormality of the metacarpal bones	An abnormality of the `metacarpal bones`(FMA:71336).	掌骨异常	掌骨的异常(FMA:71336)。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001166	Arachnodactyly	Abnormally long and slender fingers (&quot;spider fingers&quot;).	细长指(趾)	异常修长的手指（“蜘蛛指”）。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001167	Abnormality of finger	An abnormal movement of any finger.	手指异常	手指的运动异常。
肢体异常	HP:0001169	Broad palm	For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.	宽掌	儿童从出生至4岁的手掌宽度大于平均值2个标准差；4至16岁儿童的手掌宽度大于第95百分位数;或者手掌过宽，与长度不成比例。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001171	Split hand	A condition in which middle parts of the hand (fingers and metacarpals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic middle fingers over absent middel fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands.	手劈裂	手的中间部分（手指和掌骨）丢失，给人一种劈裂的外观。其严重程度是变化很大，从中指略微发育不良、中指缺如，以至寡指或单指手。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001172	Abnormality of the thumb	An anomaly of the `thumb`(FMA:24938).	拇指异常	拇指的异常(FMA:24938)。

肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001177	Preaxial hand polydactyly	Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.	轴前多指急性	额外的手指位于手的桡侧。（桡侧）多指的形式和严重程度变异性大，甚至涉及部分重复/分叉、完全重复、三倍重复的拇指，或者在内侧（手的桡侧）出现多指。
肢体异常	HP:0001178	Ulnar claw	An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.	尺侧爪形手	手的姿态异常，特征是无名指和小手指掌指关节的过伸，同时发生指间关节弯曲，向掌心屈曲。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001180	Oligodactyly (hands)	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of fingers.	少指（趾）畸形	发育缺陷造成手指数量较正常少。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001181	Adducted thumb	In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.	拇指内收	在静止位时，拇指尖端靠近或位于手掌、第四或第五指根部。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001182	Tapered finger	The gradual reduction in girth of the digit from proximal to distal.	锥形指	手指的指围从近端向末端逐渐减少。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001187	Hyperextensibility of the finger joints	The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.	指间关节过伸	指间关节的活动能力超过其运动正常范围。
肢体异常	HP:0001188	Hand clenching	An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints.	攥拳手	不正常的手姿势，双手攥紧成拳。所有手指的掌指及指间关节完全屈曲。

心血管系统异常,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001195	Single umbilical artery	Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord.	单脐动脉	单脐动脉（SUA）是指在超声影像下缺乏脐带中两条脐动脉围绕胎儿膀胱的正常声像特征，而仅见其中一条。

肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001204	Distal symphalangism (hands)	The term distal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the distal and middle phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the distal interphalangeal joint (DIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the distal interphalangeal finger creases.	远端指间关节粘连	术语远端指间关节粘连指手指远节指骨和中节指骨的骨融合，即在X线下可见远端指间关节（DIJ）缺如或指远侧纹缺如，。

The term &quot;persistent fetal fingertip pads&quot; is often used as a synonym, but should better not be used because it implies knowledge of history of the patient which often does not exist.	指尖垫突出	指尖的腹侧方面的软组织突出。术语“持续胎儿指尖垫”经常被用作同义词，但是最好不要使用，因为它暗示病人有不存在的病史。
肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001215	Camptodactyly of 2nd-5th fingers	The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the second to fifth fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.	第2-5指全屈曲	远端指间关节和/或第2-5手指的近端指间关节无法通过主动或被动的伸展，伸直到180度。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001216	Delayed ossification of carpal bones	Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.	腕骨骨化延迟	腕骨骨化发生比相应年龄阶段迟。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001217	Clubbing	Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.	杵状指	指端软组织增宽（软组织无肿胀水肿）合并指甲的纵向和横向弧度增加。

肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001234	Hitchhiker thumb	With the hand relaxed and the thumb in the plane of the palm, the axis of the thumb forms an angle of at least 90 degrees with the long axis of the hand.	“打车手势”拇指	手放松且拇指位于掌平面时，拇指的轴线与手的长轴形成至少90度角。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001238	Slender finger	Digits are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.	手指细长	手/足指/趾不成比例的狭窄（周长减少）。
肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001239	Wrist flexion contracture	A chronic loss of wrist joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the wrist.	腕关节屈曲挛缩	由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构性变化，使腕关节活动度慢性丧失，妨碍了手腕关节的正常运动。

神经系统异常	HP:0001249	Intellectual disability	Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70.	智力残疾	源于发育阶段的智力功能低于正常。智力残疾，以前被称为精神发育迟滞，定义为智商得分低于70。
神经系统异常	HP:0001250	Seizures	Seizures are an intermittent `abnormality of the central nervous system` (FMA:HP:0002011) due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures.	癫痫发作	癫痫发作是中枢神经系统（FMA:HP:0002011）因突然，过度，无序大脑神经元放电而产生的间歇性异常；临床特点由感觉障碍、意识丧失、精神功能受损、或抽搐的动作为特征。术语“癫痫”用于描述慢性，复发性癫痫发作。
神经系统异常	HP:0001251	Ataxia	Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- oder overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly).	共济失调	小脑共济失调是指由于小脑功能障碍导致的共济失调。这引起了各种基本的神经缺陷，包括协调不能（缺乏肌肉，四肢和关节之间的协调），辨距障碍（缺乏判断距离能力，可导致抓握运动时不能达到或超过目标），和轮替运动障碍（不能进行需要拮抗肌群反复切换开关的快速运动）。
肌肉组织异常	HP:0001252	Muscular hypotonia	Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching.	肌张力减退	肌张力减退是指肌张力异常低下（张力运动或拮抗运动肌肉量），常累及肌力减退。张力减退的特征在于拮抗运动减少，以被动伸展为主。
神经系统异常	HP:0001254	Lethargy	A state of  disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating.	昏睡	一种漠不关心，精神萎靡，无欲的状态，导致难以执行简单任务或集中注意力。
神经系统异常	HP:0001256	Intellectual disability, mild	Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69.	轻度智力残疾	轻度智力残疾定义为智商（IQ）在50-69的范围内。
肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	HP:0001257	Spasticity	A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.	痉挛	一种运动系统疾病，特征是速度依赖性牵张反射伴与肌张力增高，腱反射亢进（过度兴奋）。
肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	HP:0001258	Spastic paraplegia	Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles.	痉挛性截瘫	痉挛状态和小腿和臀部的肌肉无力。
神经系统异常	HP:0001259	Coma	Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli.	昏迷	完全没有觉醒和意识内容，表现为对任何外部刺激没有反应。
神经系统异常	HP:0001260	Dysarthria	Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.	构音障碍	构音障碍一般用于描述语言清晰度降低的神经言语障碍。根据受损的神经结构不同，可分为痉挛性、弛缓性、共济失调性、运动过度性、运动减弱性或混合性构音障碍。
神经系统异常	HP:0001262	Somnolence	#####	嗜睡	#####
神经系统异常	HP:0001263	Global developmental delay	A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.	全面发育迟缓	儿童重要的运动功能和精神发育迟缓，包括运动技能，言语和语言能力，认知能力和社会情感能力。此术语应仅用于描述的年龄小于五岁儿童。

神经系统异常	HP:0001266	Choreoathetosis	Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).	舞蹈手足徐动	以手足徐动（无法维持肌肉在固定位置）和舞蹈样运动（广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动）为特征的不自主运动。

神经系统异常	HP:0001274	Agenesis of corpus callosum	Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.	胼胝体发育不全	胼胝体发育障碍导致的胼胝体缺如，它可以由发育过程中的多个步骤的障碍引起，包括在中线的细胞增殖和迁移，轴突生长或神经胶质细胞生长。

神经系统异常,心血管系统异常	HP:0001278	Orthostatic hypotension	A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.	体位性低血压	当一个人变换为站立位时血压突然下降的一种低血压。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001279	Syncope	Syncope is defined as a short loss of consciousness and muscle strength, characterized by a fast onset, short duration, and spontaneous recovery.	晕厥	晕厥是指暂时性意识丧失和肌肉无力，特点是发作迅速，持续时间短，能自然恢复。
肌肉组织异常	HP:0001281	Tetany	A disorder characterized by muscle twitches, cramps, and carpopedal spasm, and when severe, laryngospasm and seizures. This condition is associated with unstable depolarization of axonal membranes, primarily in the peripheral nervous system.	手足抽搐	一个疾病的特点是肌肉抽搐，痉挛，及手足痉挛，严重时，出现喉痉挛和癫痫发作。这种病症与轴突膜不稳定去极化相关联，主要在周围神经系统。
肌肉组织异常,神经系统异常	HP:0001283	Bulbar palsy	Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.	球麻痹	球麻痹（或延髓麻痹）是指后组颅神经（九、十、十一和十二）双侧功能损害。延髓核或束水平的下运动神经元病变或者发自脑干的后组颅神经双侧病变时出现球麻痹。球麻痹往往与咀嚼困难，面部肌肉无力，构音障碍，软腭无力和呛咳，吞咽困难，发音困难相关。
神经系统异常	HP:0001284	Areflexia	Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.	神经反射消失	没有神经反射，如膝腱反应。

神经系统异常	HP:0001288	Gait disturbance	The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease.	步态不稳	步态不稳可以用于描述任何形式的行走能力受损。广义上，指因神经系统病变影响行走，但是也可以是骨折或其他原因的疼痛。目前步态不稳指因神经或肌肉病变导致的行走困难。
神经系统异常	HP:0001289	Confusion	Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.	意识模糊	缺乏明确、连贯的思维、感知、理解或行动。

神经系统异常	HP:0001293	Cranial nerve compression	Intracranial space-occupying lesions, such as intracranial tumors, brain abscess, as well as craniocerebral trauma caused by intracranial hematoma, depressed skull fractures, can lead to the symptoms of oppression of the brain.	颅神经受压	颅内占位性病变，如颅内肿瘤、脑脓肿等，以及颅脑外伤导致的颅内血肿、凹陷性颅骨骨折，均可以出现压迫大脑神经的症状。
神经系统异常,心血管系统异常	HP:0001297	Stroke	Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.	卒中	由于大脑动脉闭塞或破裂，导致供应部分大脑的血流突然受损。
神经系统异常	HP:0001298	Encephalopathy	Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.	脑病	脑病是用于描述脑部疾病、损伤或故障的术语。一般情况下，脑病可表现为精神状态改变。
神经系统异常	HP:0001300	Parkinsonism	Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.	帕金森症	由于中脑黑质产生多巴胺的神经元变性而导致以震颤、强直、行动迟缓和步态异常为特征的神经系统异常

神经系统异常	HP:0001302	Pachygyria	A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex.	巨脑回	一种表现为大脑半球皮层脑回异常增厚的一种先天性畸形。
神经系统异常	HP:0001304	Torsion dystonia	Sustained involuntary  muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.	扭转性肌张力障碍	持续不自主的肌肉收缩引起身体的扭曲和重复的动作。
神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001305	Dandy-Walker malformation	A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman&#39;s terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.	第四脑室孔闭塞综合征（Dandy-Walker畸形）	先天性脑畸形典型特征是小脑蚓部形成不完整，第四脑室扩张，以及后颅窝扩大。通俗地说，丹迪•沃克畸形是小脑和第四脑室相关的囊肿（通常是对称的）。这可能会干扰到脑脊液从脑流出的能力，导致脑积水。丹迪•沃克囊肿是在早期胚胎发育大脑形成时形成的。小脑的囊肿通常有几条血管贯穿其连接到大脑，因而无法手术切除。
神经系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001308	Tongue fasciculations	Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.	舌肌束震颤	舌肌肌束颤动或震动。

神经系统异常	HP:0001343	Kernicterus	Damage to cerebral nuclei caused in infants by highly increased levels of unconjugated bilirubin. The basal ganglia and brainstem nuclei could be shown to have a yellow staining historically in infants who died of kernicterus, that is, kernicterus is strictly speaking a pathological diagnosis. The presence of kernicterus may be inferred in infants with characteristic acute or chronic bilirubin-induced neurological dysfunction.	核黄疸	间接胆红素水平极度升高导致的婴儿大脑核团损害。死于核黄疸的婴儿组织学上显示基底节和脑干黄染，也就是说，核黄疸严格来说是一个病理诊断。婴儿存在核黄疸意味着特征性急性或慢性胆红素引起的神经功能障碍。

神经系统异常	HP:0001360	Holoprosencephaly	Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.	前脑无裂畸形	前脑无裂畸形是一种发育时前脑未能分成两个单独的半球和脑室的脑结构异常。
眼部异常	HP:0001361	Nystagmus-induced head nodding	Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.	眼球震颤诱导点头运动	头的活动与眼球震颤相联系，这可能是企图以头颅的运动代偿眼球不自主运动，提高视力。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001362	Skull defect	A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.	颅骨缺损	由胚胎期发育异常所导致的颅骨部分缺损。缺损的部位覆盖正常的皮肤。在某些病例，头颅的X射线表明潜在的溶骨性病变在一岁之前已停止。
骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001363	Craniosynostosis	Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.	颅缝早闭	颅缝早闭指颅缝的过早闭合。原发性颅缝早闭指由于头骨发育异常而导致的一个或多个颅骨缝合线闭合过早，而继发性颅缝早闭指由于大脑发育失败导致的结果。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0001367	Abnormal joint morphology	An abnormal structure or form of any joints.	关节形态异常	关节结构或形态异常。

骨骼系统异常	HP:0001370	Rheumatoid arthritis	Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.	类风湿关节炎	#####
肌肉组织异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001371	Flexion contracture	A flexion contracture is a bent (flexed) joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.	屈曲挛缩	屈曲挛缩指关节弯曲，不能主动或被动伸直。因此它是由于肌肉、肌腱、韧带或皮肤的结构变化导致的关节运动慢性损失，阻碍关节的正常运动。

遗传模式	HP:0001417	X-linked inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.	X-连锁遗传	#####
遗传模式	HP:0001419	X-linked recessive inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.	X-连锁隐性遗传	#####

遗传模式	HP:0001423	X-linked dominant inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.	X-连锁显性遗传	#####
遗传模式	HP:0001425	Heterogeneous	#####	异质性的	#####
遗传模式	HP:0001426	Multifactorial inheritance	A mode of inheritance that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants possibly together with environmental factors. Diseases inherited in this manner are termed complex diseases.	多因素遗传	#####
遗传模式	HP:0001427	Mitochondrial inheritance	A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).	线粒体遗传	#####

生长异常	HP:0001507	Growth abnormality	#####	生长异常	#####
生长异常	HP:0001508	Failure to thrive	Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.	不能生长发育	不能生长发育（FTT）是指孩子的身体生长明显低于正常。
生长异常	HP:0001510	Growth delay	A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.	生长延迟	长前和出生后生长缓慢或缺乏。
生长异常	HP:0001511	Intrauterine growth retardation	An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.	胎儿宫内发育迟缓	胎儿生长异常受限，胎儿体重低于该孕龄体重第十百分位以下。
生长异常	HP:0001513	Obesity	Body weight that is grossly above the acceptable or desirable weight, usually due to accumulation of excess fats in the body. The standards may vary with age, sex, genetic or cultural background. In the body mass index (BMI), a BMI greater than 30.0 kg/m2 is considered obese, and a BMI greater than 40.0 kg/m2 is considered morbidly obese.	肥胖	体重严重高于可接受或期望重量，通常是由于过量的脂肪在体内蓄积。该标准可能随年龄、性别、遗传或文化背景不同而变化。就身体质量指数（BMI）而言，当BMI大于30.0kg/m2被认为是肥胖，BMI大于40.0kg/m2被认为是病态肥胖。
生长异常	HP:0001518	Small for gestational age	Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.	小于胎龄儿	体型小于该性别该孕龄相关标准体型，定义为重量位于该孕龄重量第十百分位以下。
生长异常	HP:0001519	Disproportionate tall stature	A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (&gt;1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (&lt;0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.	不成比例的高身材	一个高大苗条的身材，伴随臂展与身高比增加（&gt; 1.05）和上半身与下半身比降低（&lt;0.85），即，超长的胳膊和腿。四肢及手脚都异常苗条。
生长异常	HP:0001520	Large for gestational age	The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.	大于胎龄儿	大于胎龄儿指婴儿出生时体重大于该孕龄体重90百分位以上。

肌肉组织异常,消化系统异常	HP:0001540	Diastasis recti	A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba).	腹直肌分离	腹直肌分离为左右两部分（它们通常在腹白线中线处连接）。
消化系统异常	HP:0001541	Ascites	Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.	腹水	腹腔中的液体积聚。
消化系统异常	HP:0001543	Gastroschisis	A type of congenital ventral `incomplete closure` (PATO:0000609) of the `abdominal wall` (FMA:259054) in which the intestines and sometimes other organs to extend freely into the amniotic fluid space through a small opening in the abdomen, usually to the right of the umbilicus.	腹裂	一种先天性的腹壁不完全闭合，（胎儿的）肠（有时为其他器官）经由腹壁的一个小口（通常在脐部右侧）伸出至羊水中。

骨骼系统异常	HP:0001547	Abnormality of the rib cage	A morphological anomaly of the `rib cage` (FMA:7480).	胸廓异常	胸廓（肋骨围成的笼子）的形态异常。
生长异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001548	Overgrowth	Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.	过度生长	出生后过度生长，可以包括体重的增加，身高的增加，和/或头围的增加。

骨骼系统异常	HP:0001552	Barrel-shaped chest	Barrel-shaped chest	桶状胸	桶状胸
骨骼系统异常	HP:0001555	Asymmetry of the thorax	Lack of symmetry between the left and right halves of the thorax.	胸廓不对称	缺乏胸廓的左，右两半之间的对称。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001557	Prenatal movement abnormality	An abnormality of fetal movement.	产前胎动异常	胎动异常。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001558	Decreased fetal movement	An abnormal reduction in quantity or strength of fetal movements.	胎动减少	胎动次数或强度异常减少。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001560	Abnormality of the amniotic fluid	Abnormality of the amniotic fluid, which is the fluid contained in the amniotic sac surrounding the developing fetus.	羊水异常	羊水（羊膜囊中围绕在发育中的胎儿周围的流体）的量异常。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001561	Polyhydramnios	The presence of excess amniotic fluid surrounding the fetus during pregnancy, the sonographic diagnosis of Polyhydramnios is usually based on an AFI &gt;25cm or on a single deepest pocket of amnionic fluid &gt;8cm,several groups have termed Polyhydramnios as mild if the AFI is 25 to 29.9cm, moderate if 30 to 34.9cm, and severe if 35 cm or more.	羊水过多	在妊娠期间围绕胎儿的羊水量过多， 超声诊断提示羊水指数大于25cm或羊水暗区大于8cm，其中轻度羊水过多羊水指数为25-29.9cm，中度羊水过多羊水指数为30-34.9cm，严重羊水过多羊水指数大于35cm。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001562	Oligohydramnios	The insufficient of amniotic fluid surrounding a fetus in pregnancy，the sonographic diagnosis of oligohydramnios is usually based on an AFI &lt;5cm or on a single deepest pocket of amnionic fluid &lt;2cm.	羊水过少	在妊娠期间围绕胎儿的羊水量不足。超声诊断指标是羊水指数在最深的单个区域小于5cm或羊水暗区小于2cm。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001563	Fetal polyuria	Abnormally increased production of urine by the fetus resulting in `polyhydramnios` (HP:0001561).	胎儿多尿	胎儿的异常尿液增加，并造成‘羊水过多’（:0001561 HP）。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001566	Widely-spaced maxillary central incisors	Increased distance between the `maxillary central permanent incisor tooth` (FMA:55722).	上颌中切牙牙间隙增宽	恒生牙中上颌中切牙之间的距离增宽。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001571	Multiple impacted teeth	The presence of `multiple` (PATO:0002118) `impacted teeth` (HP:0011079).	多个阻生齿	有多个阻生齿。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001572	Macrodontia	`Increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `teeth` (FMA:12516), which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.	巨牙	牙齿尺寸增加，它定义为近中远侧的牙齿直径（宽度）大于同年龄平均值以上2个SD（标准偏差）。或者牙齿的宽度显得增大。
体壁的异常	HP:0001574	Abnormality of the integument	An abnormality of the `integument` (FMA:74657), which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.	体壁的异常	体壁的异常，体壁主要由皮肤和浅筋膜构成。
神经系统异常	HP:0001575	Mood changes	#####	情绪改变	#####
内分泌系统异常	HP:0001578	Hypercortisolism	Overproduction of the hormone of "cortisol" (CHEBI:17650) by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.	皮质醇增多症	由于肾上腺皮质产生过多的皮质醇，导致一组特征性的临床症状，被称为库欣氏综合征，表现为躯干肥胖，满月脸，皮肤紫纹和痤疮，肌肉乏力和其他特征。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0001579	Primary hypercorticolism	Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.	原发性皮质醇增多症	由于原发性的肾上腺缺陷，导致皮质醇过度产生。
内分泌系统异常	HP:0001580	Pigmented micronodular adrenocortical disease	#####	色素性小结节状肾上腺皮质疾病	#####
体壁的异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001581	Recurrent skin infections	Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.	复发性皮肤感染	指多次发生的皮肤感染。
体壁的异常	HP:0001582	Redundant skin	Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.	赘肉	失去弹性而表现出松散下垂的皮肤。
眼部异常	HP:0001583	Rotary nystagmus	A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.	旋转眼球震颤	眼球震颤的一种形式，眼球绕轴旋转。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0001586	Vesicovaginal fistula	The presence of a `fistula` (MPATH:70) connecting the `urinary bladder` (FMA:15900) to the `vagina` (FMA:19949).	膀胱阴道瘘	膀胱与阴道之间形成瘘道。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0001587	Primary ovarian failure	Malfunctioning of the ovaries such that a girl never begins menstruation.	原发性卵巢功能衰竭	卵巢功能异常，使女孩从未发生月经来潮。
骨骼系统异常	HP:0001591	Bell-shaped thorax	The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, follwed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.	钟形胸	该肋骨有一个广口钟的形状。即，肋笼的上部分收缩，接下来是一个凸区域肋笼下部再扩展为大直径。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001592	Selective tooth agenesis	`Agenesis` (MPATH:57) specifically affecting one of the classes `incisor` (FMA:12823), `premolar` (FMA:55637), or `molar` (FMA:55638).	选择性牙齿发育不全	只累及中切牙、小臼齿或大臼齿之中某一类的发育不全。
头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001593	Maxillary lateral incisor microdontia	`Decreased size` (PATO:0000587) of the `maxillary permanent incisor` (FMA:55713).	上颌侧切牙小牙畸形	上颌恒切牙的尺寸减少。
体壁的异常	HP:0001595	Abnormality of the hair	An abnormality of the `hair` (FMA:53667).	毛发异常	毛发的异常。
体壁的异常	HP:0001596	Alopecia	Loss of hair from the head or body.	脱发	头部或躯体毛发的脱失。

体壁的异常	HP:0001598	Concave nail	The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.	反甲	甲先天纵向（后侧末端）凸拱不存在或反转。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001600	Abnormality of the larynx	An abnormality of the `larynx` (FMA:55097).	喉部异常	喉部（FMA:55097）的异常。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001601	Laryngomalacia	Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.	喉软骨软化	喉软骨软化是一种先天发育畸形，表现为吸气时喉软骨松软和塌陷。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001602	Laryngeal stenosis	Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.	喉狭窄	喉部受限或狭窄，可伴有与喉狭窄程度相关呼吸困难。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0001604	Vocal cord paresis	`Decreased strength` (PATO:0001779) of the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).	声带麻痹	声带运动能力减弱。
神经系统异常,呼吸系统异常	HP:0001605	Vocal cord paralysis	A loss of the ability to move the `vocal folds` (FMA:55457).	声带麻痹	声带运动能力丧失（FMA:55457）。
	HP:0001606	Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)	#####	声带麻痹（肿瘤侵犯导致）	#####

声音异常	HP:0001608	Abnormality of the voice	Any abnormality of the voice.	声音异常	嗓音的任何异常。
声音异常	HP:0001609	Hoarse voice	Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.	声音嘶哑	声音嘶哑是指声音的音调或质量的变化，声音听起来虚弱，带着很重的呼吸声，有摩擦音或沙哑。
声音异常	HP:0001611	Nasal speech	A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech, associated with incomplete or weak closure of the velum.	鼻音很重	一种构音特点，讲话时因鼻腔气流异常增加所致，与软腭关闭不全或削弱有关。
声音异常	HP:0001612	Weak cry	#####	哭声微弱	#####
	HP:0001613	Hoarse voice (caused by tumor impingement)	#####	声音嘶哑（因肿瘤挤压所致）	#####
声音异常	HP:0001615	Hoarse cry	#####	声音嘶哑的叫喊	#####
神经系统异常,声音异常	HP:0001618	Dysphonia	An impairment in the ability to produce voice sounds.	发音困难	产生声音的能力减弱。
声音异常	HP:0001620	High pitched voice	An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice.	高音调的声音	嗓音音调（频率）的异常升高。
声音异常	HP:0001621	Weak voice	Reduced intensity (volume) of speech.	嗓音微弱	语音的强度（音量）减弱。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001622	Premature birth	The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.	早产	是指妊娠不足37周间分娩者。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001623	Breech presentation	A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.	臀先露	胎儿进入产道中的先露部位为臀部或足。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001626	Abnormality of the cardiovascular system	Any abnormality of the `cardiovascular system` (FMA:7161).	心血管系统异常	心血管系统的异常（FMA:7161）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001627	Abnormality of cardiac morphology	A morphological abnormality of the `heart` (FMA:7088).	心脏形态异常	心脏形态的异常（FMA:7088）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001629	Ventricular septal defect	A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.	室间隔缺损	心脏的两个底部室（心室）之间出现孔洞。缺损一般围绕室间隔上方出现。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001631	Defect in the atrial septum	Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the `interatrial septum` (FMA:7108) that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.	房间隔缺陷	房间隔缺损（ASD）是房间隔的先天性畸形，能够导致左心房和右心房之间的血液流通（FMA:7108）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001633	Abnormality of the mitral valve	An abnormality of the `mitral valve` (FMA:7235).	二尖瓣异常	二尖瓣的异常（FMA:7235）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001634	Mitral valve prolapse	One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.	二尖瓣脱垂	左心房收缩时一个或两个二尖瓣小叶（尖）向后隆起到左心室。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001635	Congestive heart failure	The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.	充血性心力衰竭	心脏组织或压力的异常升高迫使心脏泵血的速度不符合组织对血液的需求，导致心脏功能出现异常。心脏衰竭常与心肌收缩缺陷有关。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001636	Tetralogy of Fallot	A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.	法洛四联症	一种先天性心脏畸形疾病，包括肺动脉狭窄，主动脉骑跨，室间隔缺损和右心室肥厚。 至少存在四个上述特征种的三个时可被诊断为法洛四联症。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001637	Abnormality of the myocardium	An abnormality of the myocardium.	心肌异常	心肌的异常。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001638	Cardiomyopathy	A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.	心肌病	心肌结构和功能异常的心肌疾病，在没有冠心病、高血压、心脏瓣膜病以及先天性心脏病的条件下观察到的心肌异常。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001639	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.	肥厚性心肌病	肥厚性心肌病（HCM）是指在没有继发因素（高血压，瓣膜疾病）的情况下心室壁发生肥厚的一类疾病。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001640	Cardiomegaly	`Increased size`  of the `heart` (FMA:7088).	心脏扩大	心脏（FMA:7088）体积的扩大(PATO:0000586)。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001641	Abnormality of the pulmonary valve	An abnormality of the `pulmonary valve` (FMA:7246).	肺动脉瓣异常	肺动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7246）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001642	Pulmonic stenosis	A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).	肺动脉狭窄	在肺动脉瓣（瓣膜狭窄）或略低于肺动脉瓣的部位（漏斗部狭窄）发生右心室流出道的变窄。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001643	Patent ductus arteriosus	In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.	动脉导管未闭	在子宫内，动脉导管（DA）通过将主肺动脉连接到降主动脉，使得心室输出的血液从肺分流，向胎盘转移。在出生后的前3天，在健康情况和早产新生儿中，动脉导管（PDA）生理性闭合，通常在出生后约24小时之内基本关闭，约三个星期后完全关闭。生理性关闭失败则为持续性动脉导管未闭（PDA）。根据从左到右分流的程度，动脉导管未闭可能导致临床后果。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001644	Dilated cardiomyopathy	Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.	扩张型心肌病	扩张型心肌病（DCM）被定义为，不存在其他异常病态（包括高血压、瓣膜病）或者冠心病的条件下，左心室扩张以及左心室收缩功能异常，造成系统性收缩障碍。可能存在右心室扩张和功能障碍，但不是诊断的必要条件。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001645	Sudden cardiac death	The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).	心源性猝死	心脏意外地突然停止跳动，很短时间内发生死亡（一般在发病1小时以内）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001646	Abnormality of the aortic valve	Any abnormality of the `aortic valve` (FMA:7236).	主动脉瓣异常	主动脉瓣的异常（FMA:7236）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001647	Bicuspid aortic valve	The presence of an `aortic valve` (FMA:7236) with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps).	二叶主动脉瓣	主动脉瓣只有两个瓣膜，而不是正常的三个瓣膜。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001648	Cor pulmonale	Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.	肺源性心脏病	肺动脉和右心室慢性高血压引起的右心衰竭。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001649	Tachycardia	Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.	心动过速	心脏搏动速率极快，心率通常在100次每秒以上。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001650	Aortic valve stenosis	The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.	主动脉瓣狭窄	主动脉瓣狭窄（缩小）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001651	Dextrocardia	The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or &quot;mirror reflection&quot;) of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.	右位心	心脏位于胸腔的右边，也就是说，心脏的解剖位置存在一个左-右反转（或“镜像”），心脏位于右侧，而不是左侧。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001653	Mitral regurgitation	An `abnormality of the mitral valve` (HP:0001633) characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.	二尖瓣返流	一种“二尖瓣异常”（HP:0001633），其特征是心室收缩过程中由于二尖瓣发育不全或无力，导致血液通过二尖瓣逆流、渗漏。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001654	Abnormality of the heart valves	An abnormality of a `Cardiac valve` (FMA:7110).	心脏瓣膜异常	心脏瓣膜的异常（FMA:7110）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001655	Patent foramen ovale	Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.	卵圆孔未闭	婴儿出生后卵圆孔未能闭合，导致左、右心房间存在一潜在的导管。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001657	Prolonged QT interval	Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).	QT间期延长	由心电图（EKG）测量的从Q波的起始至T波结束的时间过长。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001658	Myocardial infarction	Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.	心肌梗死	心脏血液供应的阻塞导致心肌坏死，并常伴有胸痛，气短，心悸，焦虑以及特征性的心电图结果和血清标志物肌酸激酶MB分数和肌钙蛋白升高。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001659	Aortic regurgitation	An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.	主动脉瓣反流	主动脉瓣的功能不全，导致血液从主动脉反流到左心室。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001660	Truncus arteriosus	A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.	动脉干	起源于心脏的单一动脉干。肺动脉，主动脉和冠状动脉均源于这个单一的主干而不是其他流出道。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001662	Bradycardia	A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).	心动过缓	比正常心率慢（成人心率每分钟少于60次）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001663	Ventricular fibrillation	Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.	心室纤维性颤动	不产生左心室收缩的情况下左心室肌肉纤维不受控的收缩。心室颤动通常始于室性早搏和短期的室性心动过速造成的不协调的短期心室纤维性颤动。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001664	Torsade de pointes	A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.	尖端扭转型室性心动过速	一种室性心动过速，其特征为多种形态的QRS波群改变了原有振幅和周期长度，因而在心电图中围绕基线出现振荡。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001667	Right ventricular hypertrophy	Enlargement of the right ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is often attributed to pulmonary hypertension and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.	右心室肥大	右心室的扩张。通常是由于肺动脉高压引起心室质量的增加，也导致心血管疾病的发病率和死亡率增加。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001669	Transposition of the great arteries	The most common cyanotic congenital heart lesion that presents in neonates. The hallmark of transposition of the great arteries is ventriculoarterial discordance, in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.	大动脉转位	最常见的新生儿紫绀型先天性心脏疾病。最典型的表现为心室大动脉连接异常，主动脉起自形态学上的右心室而肺动脉起自形态学上的左心室。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001670	Asymmetric septal hypertrophy	Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.	非对称性中隔肥厚	以不对称性肥厚为特征的一种心肌病，主要是室间隔肥厚和心肌排列紊乱，干扰了左心室的血液排空。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001671	Abnormality of the cardiac septa	An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.	心中隔异常	左心与右心间隔部分的异常，即心房内或心室内隔膜的异常。
	HP:0001673	Tachycardia (with pheochromocytoma)	Excessive rapidity in the action of the heart,usually with a heart rate above 100 beats per minute.	心动过速（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）	心脏运动速率极快，通常在100次每秒以上（伴有嗜铬细胞瘤）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001674	Complete atrioventricular canal defect	A congenital heart defect characteizred by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.	完全性房室通道缺损	一种先天性的心脏缺陷，其特征为房间隔缺损，室间隔缺损，房室瓣正常。
	HP:0001675	Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma	Cardiac arrhythmias associated with pheochromocytoma－caused excessive catecholamine secretion	嗜铬细胞瘤相关性心脏节律紊乱	由嗜铬细胞瘤分泌过量儿茶酚胺所引起的心律失常
	HP:0001676	Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)	Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)	心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）	心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）
心血管系统异常	HP:0001677	Coronary artery disease	Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.	冠状动脉疾病	冠状动脉壁内粥样斑块的积聚导致冠状动脉直径减小，增加了心肌缺血的风险。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001678	Atrioventricular block	Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.	房室传导阻滞	房室结介导的心房去极化向心室传导的延迟或阻滞。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001679	Abnormality of the aorta	An abnormality of the `aorta` (FMA:3734).	主动脉异常	主动脉的异常（FMA:3734）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001680	Coarctation of aorta	Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.	主动脉缩窄	主动脉节段性的狭窄或阻塞。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001681	Angina pectoris	Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.	心绞痛	用力过度或应激状态引起的突发性胸痛，与心肌缺血有关。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001682	Subaortic stenosis	A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the `left-ventricular outflow tract` (FMA:9473) related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.	主动脉基部狭窄	血液流经左室流出道时发生梗阻，与主动脉瓣下狭窄有关。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001683	Ectopia cordis	Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.	心脏异位	通过腹壁上的裂缝，心脏部分或者全部暴露在胸腔外的先天腹壁畸形。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001684	Secundum atrial septal defect	A kind of `atrial septum defect`（HP:0001631） arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.	第二房间隔缺损	一种`房间隔缺损`（HP:0001631），由卵圆孔扩大，第二房间隔发育不全，或第一房间隔过度吸收引起。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001685	Myocardial fibrosis	Cardiac fibrosis commonly refers to the proliferation of fibroblasts in the cardiac muscle.	心肌纤维化	心肌纤维化是指心肌组织中成纤维细胞异常增殖。
声音异常	HP:0001686	Loss of voice	#####	失声	#####
心血管系统异常	HP:0001688	Sinus bradycardia	Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.	窦性心动过缓	心动过缓指的是静息状态下平均窦性心率少于每分钟50次。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001691	Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis	A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow though the left-ventricular outflow tract.	肌性主动脉瓣下狭窄	一类室间隔肌肉增厚引起的主动脉瓣下狭窄，这导致血液流经左心室流出道受阻。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001692	Primary atrial arrhythmia	A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.	原发性房性心律失常	阵发性室上性心搏过速的一种，是原发性的心脏电生理传导紊乱。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001693	Cardiac shunt	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.	心脏分流	偏离正常血液循环的心脏血流模式。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001694	Right-to-left shunt	Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.	右向左分流	血液在心脏流动的回路发生异常，出现从右向左流动。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001695	Cardiac arrest	Cardiac arrest, also known as cardiopulmonary arrest or circulatory arrest, is a sudden stop in effective blood circulation due to the failure of the heart to contract effectively or at all.	心脏骤停	心脏骤停也称为心肺骤停或循环骤停，由心脏收缩功能部分或完全丧失，导致血液循环突然停止。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001696	Situs inversus totalis	A left-right reversal (or &quot;mirror reflection&quot;) of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.	全内脏反位	胸腹主要器官的解剖学位置左右反转（或“镜面反射”）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001697	Abnormality of the pericardium	An abnormality of the `pericardium` (FMA:9869), i.e., of the  fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.	心包异常	心包异常是指包绕在心脏和和大血管根部(如主动脉近端，腔静脉，和肺动脉)外的双层囊性结构发生异常。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001698	Pericardial effusion	Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.	心包积液	心包内液体积累。
死亡/衰老	HP:0001699	Sudden death	Rapid and unexpected death.	猝死	#####
心血管系统异常	HP:0001700	Myocardial necrosis	Myocardial cells take place necrosis	心肌坏死	心肌坏死。
心血管系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001701	Pericarditis	Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).	心包炎	包裹在心脏周围的囊状物（心包）发生的炎症反应。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001702	Abnormality of the tricuspid valve	An abnormality of the `tricuspid valve` (FMA:7234).	三尖瓣异常	右房室瓣即三尖瓣的异常（FMA:7234）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001704	Tricuspid valve prolapse	One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.	三尖瓣脱垂	右心室收缩时三尖瓣瓣膜的一个或多个瓣叶（尖）的向后凸出进入右心房。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001705	Right ventricular outlet obstruction	One feathers of the tetralogy of fallot, right ventricular outlet get narrowing or obstructing in infundibulum, infundibulum, pulmonary valve ring, main pulmonary artery or branch pulmonary artery.	右心室流出道梗阻	法洛四联症特征之一，右心室流出道狭窄或梗阻可位于漏斗部，肺动脉瓣膜部，肺动脉瓣环，肺动脉主干或肺动脉分支。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001706	Endocardial fibroelastosis	A condition characterized by hypertrophy of the wall of the left ventricle and conversion of the endocardium into a thick fibroelastic coat,with the capacity of the ventricle sometimes reduced,but often increased.	心内膜弹力纤维增生症	一种疾病状态，以左心室壁肥厚、心内膜外包裹一层厚的弹力纤维组织帽为特征，心室功能偶有降低，但通常增强。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001707	Abnormality of the right ventricle	An abnormality of the `right ventricle` (FMA:7098) of the heart.	右心室异常	心脏右心室的异常（FMA:7098）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001708	Right ventricular failure	Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading top pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.	右心衰竭	右心室行使其功能的能力（从肺动脉接收血液和将血液泵入右心房）减弱，经常导致外周性水肿，腹水和肝肿大。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001709	Third degree atrioventricular block	A form of  atrioventricular block  in which atrial impulse propagates to the ventricles.	三度房室传导阻滞	房室传导阻滞的一种，心房的冲动无法传导到心室。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001710	Conotruncal defect	A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.	圆锥动脉干缺损	先天性心脏流出道畸形。圆锥动脉干畸形被认为是由于胚胎时期心脏流出道畸形造成的，包括动脉干永存，法洛四联症，主动脉弓中断，大动脉转位以及右心室双出口。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001711	Abnormality of the left ventricle	An abnormality of the `left ventricle` (FMA:7101) of the heart.	左心室异常	心脏左心室的异常（7101 FMA）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001712	Left ventricular hypertrophy	Enlargement of the left ventricle of the heart. This increase in ventricular mass is attributed to sustained abnormal pressure or volume loads and is a contributor to cardiovascular morbidity and mortality.	左心室肥大	由于长期压力或容量负荷异常引起的心脏左心室扩张，是由心室质量增大形成的，是心血管病发病和死亡的一个重要原因。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001713	Abnormality of cardiac ventricle	An abnormality of a `cardiac ventricle` (FMA:7100).	心室异常	心脏心室的异常（FMA:7100）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001714	Ventricular hypertrophy	Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.	心室肥厚	心脏心室肌肉组织扩大、心室壁增宽并失去弹性。心室肥厚在临床上分为左，右心室肥厚。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001716	Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome	A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.	午-帕-怀三氏综合征	由于房室附加通路产生异常冲动,造成心室提前激动的一种心脏传导系统紊乱疾病。
心血管系统异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001717	Coronary artery calcification	`Calcification` (PATO:0001447), that is, pathological  deposition of calcium salts, affecting  the `coronary arteries` (FMA:3800).	冠状动脉钙化	钙化（PATO:0001447），即钙盐的病理性沉积，影响`冠状动脉`（FMA:3800）。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001718	Mitral stenosis	Ab abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.	二尖瓣狭窄	二尖瓣的孔口异常狭窄。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001719	Double outlet right ventricle	Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.	右室双出口	右室双出口（DORV）是一种心室与动脉的异常连接，指两个大血管（主动脉和肺动脉）完全或主要从右心室发出。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001722	High-output congestive heart failure	A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.	高输出充血性心脏衰竭	心输出量升高的一种心力衰竭形式。这可能发生在患有心脏衰竭和甲状腺功能亢进症，贫血，妊娠，动静脉瘘和其他疾病的患者中。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001723	Restrictive cardiomyopathy	Myocardial disease in which the ventricular walls are excessively rigid,impeding ventricular filling; it is marked by abnormal diastolic function but by normal or nearly normal systolic function.	限制性心肌病	限制性心肌病是一类心室壁过分坚硬，阻碍心室充盈的心肌病，其特征为心脏舒张功能异常，而收缩功能却正常或几乎正常。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001724	Aortic dilatation	Aorta enlarge to greater than normal size.	主动脉扩张	主动脉增大，超过正常大小。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001726	Increased prevalence of valvular disease	Increased prevalence of valvular disease	瓣膜病发病率增加	瓣膜病发病率增加
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001727	Thromboembolic stroke	A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.	血栓栓塞性脑卒中	由于血栓栓塞发生脑血管意外（脑卒中/中风）。
耳部异常	HP:0001730	Progressive hearing impairment	An abnormality of the `ear` (FMA:52780).	渐进性听力损失	一种进行性的（PATO:0001818）听力丧失（===HP:0000365===）。
消化系统异常	HP:0001732	Abnormality of the pancreas	An abnormality of the `pancreas` (FMA:7198).	胰腺异常	胰腺的异常。

消化系统异常	HP:0001734	Annular pancreas	A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.	环状胰	一种胰腺先天异常：胰腺完全（有时候不完全）环绕十二指肠第二段，且偶尔会阻塞更近段的十二指肠。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001735	Acute pancreatitis	A `acute` (PATO:0000389) form of `pancreatitis` (HP:0001733).	急性胰腺炎	一种急性形式的胰腺炎。
消化系统异常	HP:0001737	Pancreatic cysts	A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.	胰腺囊肿	被覆粘膜上皮的胰腺囊肿。
消化系统异常	HP:0001738	Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency	Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.	胰腺外分泌功能不全	#####

头部和颈部的异常	HP:0001742	Nasal obstruction	Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.	鼻塞	降低空气通过鼻腔的能力，常常导致用口呼吸。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001743	Abnormality of the spleen	An abnormality of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).	脾脏异常	脾脏的异常。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001744	Splenomegaly	Abnormal `increased size` (PATO:0000586) of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).	脾肿大	脾脏尺寸异常增加。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001746	Asplenia	Absence (aplasia) of the `spleen` (FMA:7196).	无脾	脾的缺失（不发育）。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001747	Accessory spleen	An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.	副脾	副脾为一个圆形的、等超声波回声的、均质且光滑的结构，是一种正常变异，其多数位于脾的内侧轮廓，邻近门区或在下极周围。无致病相关性。
消化系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001748	Polysplenia	Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.	多脾	多脾是一种先天性疾病，表现为多个小的副脾。
心血管系统异常	HP:0001750	Single ventricle	The exist of single ventricle in the heart.	单心室	心脏只有一个心室。
耳部异常	HP:0001751	Vestibular dysfunction	An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.	前庭功能障碍	前庭器官的功能异常。
耳部异常	HP:0001756	Vestibular hypofunction	Reduced functioning of the vestibular apparatus.	前庭功能减退	前庭器官的功能减弱。
耳部异常	HP:0001757	High-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment	Reduced functioning of the vestibular apparatus.	高频感音神经性听力障碍	以损害高频听力为主的“感音神经性听力障碍” （HP: 0008538）的类型。
肢体异常	HP:0001760	Abnormality of the foot	An abnormality of the `skeleton of foot` (FMA:24222).	足部异常	足的骨骼异常。
肢体异常	HP:0001761	Pes cavus	The presence of an unusually high `plantar arch` (FMA:43942). Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight.	高弓足	足弓（FMA:43942）异常高。也称为高脚背，足弓是指承重时脚底与鞋底间的明显空间。
肢体异常	HP:0001762	Talipes equinovarus	Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.	马蹄内翻足	马蹄内翻足通常有四个主要组成部分：前足折反内收、脚跟和足后部反转、踝关节和距下关节马蹄形（伸展受限）和腿向内旋转。
肢体异常	HP:0001763	Pes planus	A foot where the `plantar arch` (FMA:43942) is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.	扁平足	扁平足（FMA:43942）是当人直立时足底与地板或地面可以接触;或者在患者仰卧时，检查者用平板以预期负重的压力压紧脚底时两者表面接触;或者足弓的高度减小。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001765	Hammertoe	Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.	槌状趾	跖骨过伸伴趾间关节过度屈曲。
肢体异常	HP:0001769	Broad foot	A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.	宽足	足部的测量宽度大于同龄人群的第95百分位数;或者过宽，与足的长度不成比例。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001770	Toe syndactyly	Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are revered to as &quot;bony&quot; Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are refered to as &quot;Symphalangism&quot;.	脚趾并趾畸形	脚趾间存在蹼或融合脚趾，可以仅涉及软组织或包括骨骼结构。发生在胫-腓轴线的骨性融合被称为“骨性并趾畸形”；脚趾在近-远端轴的骨性融合被称为“关节粘连”。
肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001771	Achilles tendon contracture	A contracture of the `Achilles tendon` (FMA:51061).	跟腱挛缩	在跟腱（FMA:51061）位置发生的挛缩。
肢体异常	HP:0001772	Talipes equinovalgus	A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.	马蹄外翻足	脚和踝关节变形，脚向下向外弯曲。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001773	Short foot	A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).	短足	27-41周的胎儿足的长度低于平均值2个标准差以上；出生-16岁的人群，足长度小于人群的第3百分位数（客观）。另外，足的长度与宽度出现不成比例短脚（主观）。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001775	Tarsal osteovalgus	#####	跗骨骨外翻	#####
肢体异常	HP:0001776	Bilateral talipes equinovarus	Bilateral clubfoot deformity (see HP:0001762).	双侧马蹄内翻足	双侧马蹄内翻足畸形（请参阅HP:0001762）。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001780	Abnormality of toe	An anomaly of a `toe` (FMA:25046).	脚趾异常	脚趾的异常。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001782	Bulbous tips of toes	An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.	球茎状趾尖	脚趾的形态学异常，脚趾尖突出形似球茎。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001783	Broad metatarsal	Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.	跖骨变宽	跖骨一侧到另一侧的宽度增加。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001785	Ankle swelling	#####	踝关节肿胀	#####
肢体异常	HP:0001786	Narrow foot	A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.	窄足	足部宽度低于同龄人群第5百分位数;或者足的宽度与长度出现不成比例的狭窄足。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001787	Abnormal delivery	An abnormality of the birth process.	分娩异常	产程中出现异常。
胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001788	Premature rupture of membranes	Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.	胎膜早破	距临产时间超过1小时以上时发生的胎膜破裂。
代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001789	Hydrops fetalis	The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.	胎儿水肿	两个或以上的胎儿体内腔隙出现异常液体积聚，包括腹水，胸水，心包积液和皮肤水肿。
代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001790	Nonimmune hydrops fetalis	Nonimmune hydrops fetalis is a serious fetal condition in which abnormal fluid accumulates in at least two different compartments ,and in which ciruulating antibodies against red cell antigens are absent in the mother.	非免疫性胎儿水肿	非免疫性胎儿水肿是指胎儿体内出现两处或以上不同部位的体液异常聚积；但母体循环中没有抗胎儿红细胞抗体
消化系统异常,胎儿产前发育或出生异常	HP:0001791	Fetal ascites	Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.	胎儿腹水	胎儿期腹腔内的液体积累。
体壁的异常	HP:0001792	Small nail	A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped `nail` (FMA:54326).	微甲	甲的长度和宽度变短或变窄，即未充分发育的甲。
体壁的异常	HP:0001795	Hyperconvex nail	When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner&#39;s eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.	甲异常凸起	当检查者看向指（趾）尖部位时，可观察到甲表面有纵向凸起。

体壁的异常	HP:0001805	Thick nail	Nail that appears thick when viewed on end.	厚甲	从甲的末端可以观察到甲增厚。
体壁的异常	HP:0001806	Onycholysis	Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.	甲分离	甲板从甲床分离。
体壁的异常	HP:0001807	Ridged nail	Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.	甲纵嵴	甲板纵向线性突起。
体壁的异常	HP:0001808	Fragile nails	Nails that easily break.	脆甲	甲容易断裂。
体壁的异常	HP:0001809	Split nail	A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.	甲纵裂	甲板沿纵轴分裂但是沿横轴依然相连。
体壁的异常	HP:0001810	Dystrophic toenail	Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.	趾甲营养不良	趾甲异常包括颜色的改变（甲变色）和甲板部分或完全性毁损。
体壁的异常	HP:0001812	Hyperconvex fingernails	When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner&#39;s eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.	指甲异常凸起	当检查者看向指尖部位时可以观察到甲表面有纵向凸起。
体壁的异常	HP:0001814	Deep-set nails	Deeply placed nails.	嵌甲	甲长到皮肤里。
体壁的异常	HP:0001816	Thin nail	Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.	薄甲	从甲的末端可观察到甲变薄。
体壁的异常	HP:0001817	Absent fingernail	Absence of a `fingernail`(FMA:54327).	指甲缺损	指甲的缺损。
体壁的异常	HP:0001818	Paronychia	The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).	甲沟炎	甲沟炎常发生在甲侧缘或基底部，由常见易感细菌或真菌感染引起，感染可急性发生（急性甲沟炎）或慢性发展（慢性甲沟炎）。
体壁的异常	HP:0001820	Leukonychia	White discoloration  of the `nails` (FMA:54326).	白甲	甲褪色呈白色。
体壁的异常	HP:0001821	Broad nail	Increased width of nail.	宽甲	甲的宽度增加。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001822	Hallux valgus	Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).	拇趾外翻	拇趾的横向偏差（即小趾方向）。
生长异常	HP:0001824	Weight loss	Reduction inexisting body weight.	体重减轻	体重减少。
泌尿生殖系统异常	HP:0001827	Genital tract atresia	Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.	生殖道闭锁	生殖道的先天性管道闭塞。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001829	Foot polydactyly	A kind of `polydactyly` (HP:0010442) characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.	足多趾	一种多趾畸形（HP:0010442），特点是存在额外的脚趾
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001830	Postaxial foot polydactyly	Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.	轴后趾足	多趾畸形最常见的是单足存在六个脚趾。 轴后多趾形成影响外侧幅肋，此外重复可能形成形态良好的关节和趾，也可能形成非常初级的趾。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001831	Short toe	A `toe` (FMA:25046) that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.	短趾	脚趾（FMA:25046）与足部相比出现不成比例的短。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001832	Abnormality of the metatarsal bones	Abnormalities of the `metatarsal bones` (FMA:24492) (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).	跖骨异常	跖骨的异常，跖骨是位于足后部和足中部的跗骨和脚趾的趾骨之间的五个管状骨。
肢体异常	HP:0001833	Long foot	Increased back to front length of the foot.	长足	足跟至前部的长度增加。
肌肉组织异常,肢体异常,结缔组织异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001836	Camptodactyly of toe	Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.	脚趾屈曲畸形	近端趾间关节逐步渐进的无痛屈曲挛缩。这个术语是指一个或多个脚趾屈曲畸形。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001837	Broad toe	Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.	宽趾	非拇趾的脚趾宽度明显增加而背腹间高度不增加。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001838	Rocker bottom foot	The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.	摇椅底足	双足跟突出及鞋子可见凸出轮廓。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001839	Split foot	A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.	脚劈裂	脚的中间部分（脚趾和跖骨）缺如，呈现劈裂外观。严重性变化很大，从第三脚趾轻度发育不良、第二或第三脚趾缺如，到寡趾或单趾脚。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001840	Metatarsus adductus	The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.	跖骨异常	跖骨均向内侧偏离（胫侧），即前足部的骨骼向体侧弯曲或转动。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001841	Preaxial foot polydactyly	Duplication of all or part of the first ray.	轴前趾足	第一幅肋部分或全部重复。

肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001845	Overlapping toe	Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest.	重叠趾	描述静息状态时，一个足趾位于邻近的另一个足趾的背侧面上。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001847	Long hallux	Increased length of the `big toe` (FMA:25047).	长拇趾	拇趾（FMA:25047）的长度增加。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001848	Calcaneovalgus deformity	This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).	足外翻畸形	足相对胫骨的姿势畸形。足跟（跟骨）向下（即踝向上弯曲）和向外翻转（外翻）。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001849	Oligodactyly (feet)	A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.	少趾畸形	发育缺陷造成脚趾的数量少于正常数量。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001850	Abnormality of the tarsal bones	An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.	跗骨异常	跗骨的异常，跗骨是足部由七个骨头组成的骨头群，位于胫骨、腓骨和跖骨之间，包括跟骨（脚跟骨）和距骨（脚踝）骨。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001852	Sandal gap	A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.	趾间畸形	第一、二趾之间的间距增大。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001853	Bifid distal phalanx of toe	#####	远节趾骨骨裂	#####
肢体异常,代谢紊乱/稳态失衡,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001854	Gout (feet)	`Gout` (HP:0001997) affecting the `Metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe`.	痛风（足）	痛风（HP:0001997）影响大脚趾的跖趾关节。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001857	Short distal phalanx of toe	Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short `distal phalanx of toe` (FMA:75830).	远节趾骨短小	远节趾骨（FMA:75830）从脚趾末端到趾远侧纹或远端趾间关节屈曲点距离异常短，即远节趾骨异常短。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001871	Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues	An abnormality of the `hematopoietic system` (FMA:9667).	血液和造血组织异常	造血系统的异常（FMA:9667）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001872	Abnormality of thrombocytes	An abnormality of `platelets` (CL:0000233).	血小板异常	血小板异常（CL:0000233）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001873	Thrombocytopenia	A reduction in the number of circulating `thrombocytes` (CL:0000762).	血小板减少症	血循环中血小板（:0000762 CL）的数量的减少。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001874	Abnormality of neutrophils	A `neutrophil` (CL:0000775) abnormality.	中性粒细胞异常	中性粒细胞（CL:0000775）异常。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001875	Neutropenia	An abnormally low number of `neutrophils` (CL:0000775) in the peripheral `blood` (FMA:9670).	中性粒细胞减少症	外周血中性粒细胞数目异常降低。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001876	Pancytopenia	An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).	全血细胞减少症	所有血细胞类型的数目的异常降低（红细胞，白细胞，和血小板）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001877	Abnormality of erythrocytes	An abnormality of `erythrocytes` (CL:0000232) (red-blood cells).	红细胞异常	红细胞异常（CL:0000232）（红血细胞）。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001878	Hemolytic anemia	A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).	溶血性贫血	一型由红细胞（溶血）过早破坏引起的贫血。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001879	Abnormality of eosinophils	An `eosinophil` (CL:0000771) abnormality.	嗜酸性粒细胞异常	嗜酸性粒细胞（CL:0000771）异常。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001880	Eosinophilia	Increased count of `eosinophils` (CL:0000771) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	嗜酸性粒细胞增多症	血中（FMA:9670）嗜酸粒细胞（CL:0000771）增加。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001881	Abnormality of leukocytes	An abnormality of `leukocytes` (CL:0000738).	白细胞异常	白细胞的异常（CL:0000738）。
血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001882	Leukopenia	An abnormal decreased number of `leukocytes` (CL:0000738) in the `blood` (FMA:9670).	白细胞减少症	血液中白细胞（CL:0000738）的数量异常减少。
肢体异常	HP:0001883	Talipes	A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.	畸形足	足和踝部的变形，有不同的亚型:马蹄内翻足、马蹄外翻足、仰趾内翻足和仰趾外翻足。
肢体异常	HP:0001884	Talipes calcaneovalgus	Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an &quot;up and out&quot; appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.	仰趾外翻足	仰趾外翻足是一种柔软的足畸形（相对于僵硬的先天性垂直型距骨变形足），可以任一形式出现，位置性的或结构性的足变形，取决于其严重性和/或病因。 仰趾外翻足变形的轴线是在胫距关节，足的位置处于极端过伸状态。脚呈现“向上向外”的外观，足背几乎接触到踝关节和小腿下端的前部。
肢体异常,骨骼系统异常	HP:0001885	Short 2nd toe	Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the `second toe` (FMA:25048).	短第2趾	&#39;第二趾`不发达（发育不全）（FMA:25048）。
神经系统异常,肢体异常	HP:0001886	Osteomyelitis or necrosis, distal, due to sensory neuropathy (feet)	#####	由于感觉神经病变导致的远节骨髓炎或坏死（足）	#####

血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001890	Autoimmune hemolytic anemia	An autoimmune form of `hemolytic anemia` (HP:0001878).	自身免疫性溶血性贫血	一种与自身免疫有关的溶血性贫血（HP:0001878）。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001898	Increased red blood cell mass	The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.	红细胞增多症	循环中的的红细胞量增加。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001899	Increased hematocrit	An increase in the volume of packed erythrocytes in a blood specimen.	红细胞压积增高	在血液检测样本中红细胞累积体积增加。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001900	Increased hemoglobin	#####	血红蛋白增多	#####
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001901	Polycythemia	Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.	红细胞增多症	红细胞增多症的诊断原则是红细胞计数、血红蛋白水平和红细胞体积都超过正常值的上限。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001902	Giant platelets	Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).	巨血小板	巨血小板大于7微米，并且通常为10至20微米。当血小板比该视野中平均红细胞的大小大时称为巨血小板。 （来自美国病理学院，血液学手册，1998年描述改编）。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001907	Thromboembolism	The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.	血栓栓塞症	血管内血栓形成，随后通过血液从原发处移动至体内另一个部位，通常导致远端部位血管闭塞。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001908	Hypoplastic anemia	Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.	再生不良性贫血	伴有不同程度的红细胞发育不全、无白细胞或血小板减少的贫血。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001924	Sideroblastic anemia	Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).	铁粒幼细胞性贫血	铁粒幼细胞性贫血是由于铁掺入血红蛋白分子的缺陷。铁粒幼红细胞是有铁质沉淀于细胞质（这可以通过普鲁士蓝染色证明）的红细胞。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001927	Acanthocytosis	Acanthocytosis is a type of `poikilocytosis` (HP:0004447) characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shaped resembling many-pointed stars.	棘形红细胞增多症	棘形红细胞增多症是血细胞形态多样性（HP:0004447）的一种类型，其特征在细胞表面出现尖峰样突起。该细胞形状不规则，类似于五角星。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001928	Abnormality of coagulation	An abnormality of the process of `blood coagulation` (GO:0007596). That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.	凝血异常	凝血的过程异常（GO:0007596）。也就是说，凝血能力改变或不能凝血。
血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001929	Reduced factor XI activity	Decreased activity of `coagulation factor XI` (PR:000007295). Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine prote¨ªnase that activates factor IX	XI凝血因子活性降低	`凝血因子XI`（PR:000007295）的活性降低。XI因子，也被称为血浆凝血激酶前体，是一种可以激活IX因子的丝氨酸蛋白酶。

血液和造血组织异常	HP:0001978	Extramedullary hematopoiesis	The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.	骨髓外造血	发生在骨髓以外的部位（在肝脏，胸腺，脾脏）造血。

血液和造血组织异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0001982	Sea-blue histiocytosis	An abnormality of `macrophages` (CL:0000235), also known as histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content.	海蓝色组织细胞增多症	`巨噬细胞`（CL:0000235）的一种异常，也被称为组织细胞症，细胞由于异常脂质含量增加而呈现海蓝色外观。

神经系统异常	HP:0002062	Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract	Any structural abnormality of the `pyramidal tract` (FMA:72634), whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.	锥体束的形态异常	所有锥体束（FMA:72634）的结构异常，其主要成分，皮质脊髓束，是脑和脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。除了皮质脊髓束，锥体系统包括皮质延髓束，皮质中脑束，皮质脑桥束。
神经系统异常	HP:0002063	Rigidity	Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.	强直	连续持续性不自主的肌肉收缩。当受影响的肌肉被动拉伸，无论肌肉的受牵拉稠度怎样，拮抗的程度保持恒定。此功能有助于区分肌肉痉挛还是强直。

神经系统异常	HP:0002067	Bradykinesia	Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).	运动迟缓	运动迟缓的字面意思是缓慢运动，临床上用于表示运动执行缓慢（相对于运动减少，这是用来指运动的起始缓慢）。

神经系统异常	HP:0002069	Generalized tonic-clonic seizures	Generalized tonic-clonic seizures are `generalized seizures` (HP:0002197) with bilateral symmetrical tonic contraction then bilateral clonic contractions of somatic muscles usually associated with autonomic phenomena.	全面性强直-阵挛发作	全面性强直-阵挛发作是全面性发作（HP:0002197），躯体肌肉双侧对称性强直收缩，然后阵挛性收缩，通常伴有自主神经症状。
神经系统异常	HP:0002070	Limb ataxia	A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects movements of the extremities.	肢体共济失调	影响肢体运动的一种共济失调（HP:0001251）。
神经系统异常	HP:0002071	Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function	A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).	锥体外系功能障碍	与基底节病变导致神经状态异常，典型的表现包括运动不能（无法启动动作，或不能迅速和容易地进行随意运动），肌强直（广泛的无节律的肌肉快速持续收缩），舞蹈症（普遍一个强制，快速，干，和不宁性质）的心律失常的动作，手足徐动症（不能维持手指，脚趾，或其他组的肌肉中的固定位置的肌肉），和静坐不能（不能保持不动）。
神经系统异常	HP:0002072	Chorea	Chorea (Greek for &#39;dance&#39;) refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion.	舞蹈样运动	舞蹈样运动（希腊文“跳舞”），指的是广泛无节奏的不自主强行运动，表现为抽动样，坐立不安。
神经系统异常	HP:0002073	Progressive cerebellar ataxia	#####	进行性小脑共济失调	#####
神经系统异常	HP:0002074	Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment	Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.	神经元自体荧光脂褐素增加	脂褐素，自体荧光脂褐素的专业术语，是积聚在最衰老细胞的蛋白质和脂质混合物，尤其是涉及高脂质转换（例如，肾上腺髓质）或吞噬的其他类型细胞（例如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）。此术语适用于神经元脂褐素（也称为自身荧光脂蛋白）的积聚增加是否超过患者预期的年龄。
神经系统异常	HP:0002075	Dysdiadochokinesis	A type of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as rhythmically tapping the fingers on the knee, generally related to a cerebellar lesion.	轮替运动障碍	`共济失调`（HP:0001251）的表现之一，表现为进行快速交替运动的功能受损，比如不能有节奏地用手拍打膝盖，一般为小脑病变所致。
神经系统异常	HP:0002076	Migraine	Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.	偏头痛	偏头痛是一种慢性神经系统疾病，特点是发作性头痛及相关症状。
神经系统异常	HP:0002077	Migraine with aura	A type of `migraine` (HP:0002076) in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.	有先兆偏头痛	偏头痛（HP:0002076）的一种类型，先兆的特点为局灶性神经现象，通常进行性的，可伴有或不伴有头痛。先兆的症状可以包括完全可逆的视觉，感觉，和言语症状，但没有运动无力。视觉症状可能包括闪光、点、线和/或视觉缺失，和/或单侧感觉症状诸如感觉异常或麻木。至少一个的先兆症状逐渐发展超过5分钟或更长时间，和/或不同的症状连续发生。
神经系统异常	HP:0002078	Truncal ataxia	A kind of `ataxia` (HP:0001251) that affects the proximal musculature, especially that involved in gait stability.	躯干性共济失调	一种影响近端肌肉的共济失调（HP:0001251），尤其是那些参与步态稳定的肌肉。
神经系统异常	HP:0002079	Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum	Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.	胼胝体发育不良	胼胝体发育不完全。
神经系统异常	HP:0002080	Intention tremor	An oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient&#39;s nose or a physician&#39;s finger).	意向性震颤	摆动性小脑性共济失调，肢体静止或刚开始随意运动时消失，持续运动和需要更加精准时加重（例如，触摸目标如患者的鼻子或医生的手指） 。
神经系统异常	HP:0002083	Migraine without aura	Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.	无先兆偏头痛	反复的头痛发作持续4-72小时，符合至少下列两个的标准:1）单侧，2）搏动性，3）中度或重度疼痛，和4）日常体力活动可加重，避免日常活动避免如爬楼梯。头痛发作通常伴有恶心，呕吐，畏光，或畏声。
神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0002084	Encephalocele	A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.	脑膨出	一种神经管缺陷，其特征为脑的囊样突起，以及颅骨开口处覆盖脑的膜上的囊样突起。
神经系统异常,骨骼系统异常,头部和颈部的异常	HP:0002085	Occipital encephalocele	A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.	枕部脑膨出	一种发生在颅骨的枕骨区域的脑膨出（即，颅内容物包括脑组织从通常覆盖有皮肤或粘膜的头盖骨上的先天性开口突出去）。枕叶脑膨出表现为枕骨中线肿胀，通常有正常厚度的头皮覆盖。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002086	Abnormality of the respiratory system	An abnormality of the `respiratory system` (FMA:7158), which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.	呼吸系统异常	呼吸系统（FMA:7158）的异常，包括呼吸道，肺部和呼吸肌。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002087	Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract	An abnormality of the `upper respiratory tract` (FMA:45661).	上呼吸道异常	`上呼吸道`（FMA:45661）的异常。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0002092	Pulmonary hypertension	Pulmonary hypertension is defined as a mean pulmonary artery pressure greater than 25 mm Hg during rest (normal level, 10 mm Hg) or greater than 30 mm Hg during exercise (normal level, 15 mm Hg), as determined with right heart catheterization.	肺动脉高压	肺动脉高血压被定义为在休息平均肺动脉压大于25毫米汞柱（正常水平10毫米汞柱），或在锻炼期间大于30毫米汞柱（正常水平15毫米汞柱）。肺动脉压力通过右心脏导管检查来确定。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002093	Respiratory insufficiency	Failure to adequately provide oxygen to cells of the body and to remove excess carbon dioxide.	呼吸功能不全	不能为机体细胞提供充足的氧气和除去过量的二氧化碳。
呼吸系统异常	HP:0002094	Dyspnea	Difficult or labored breathing.	呼吸困难	呼吸费力或劳力性呼吸困难。

呼吸系统异常,免疫系统异常	HP:0002100	Recurrent aspiration pneumonia	Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.	反复吸入性肺炎	由吸入性肺炎易感性增加导致。反复吸入性肺炎是由于吸入异物导致的肺炎，表现为吸入性肺炎反复性发作。

呼吸系统异常	HP:0002104	Apnea	Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.	呼吸暂停	呼吸肌无运动，肺中无气体交换。这个术语指呼吸暂停反复发作，而不是一个单一的事件。

神经系统异常	HP:0002123	Generalized myoclonic seizures	Seizures with sudden, brief (&lt; 100 msec) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal).	全身性肌阵挛发作	癫痫发作，突然、短暂的（&lt;100毫秒）的单块肌肉或肌群不自主地单次或多次不规则收缩（轴性，四肢近端，远端）。

神经系统异常	HP:0002136	Broad-based gait	An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.	宽基步态	是一种异常的步态模式，站立和行走时双脚距离很宽。这往往是小脑性共济失调的组成部分。
